"Agathaaa, we need to be up in three hours to make it to the airstrip,"Rio exhaled in a sigh that was far more worked up than it should have been at three in the morning when they had to get up at six. Agatha's insatiability had kept them busy since the moment they had walked in that door but Rio knew both of them would be useless if they did not try to have some sort of nap, at the very least.

Together, they had just experienced the biggest day of their lives, the day when everyone around them got to watch as they promised each other an eternity, despite what life might try to deliver them. Together, they had made their own personal agreement that despite the insanity their lives had been since the day they'd met and despite how crazy it would probably always be going forward, they would meet any challenge side by side. They always had. Together, they were going to keep their love alive.

In that moment, Agatha's way of fanning the flame was wanting to pay attention to her brand new wife in the most intimate and pleasurable ways. Rio could almost hear it, the way Agatha was desperate in that head of hers to squeeze as much into the day before it became a new one. She wanted to pack it as full of memories as she could.

Who would Rio have been to tell her no?

"One more,"came a whisper of agreement, though Rio's head lulled slightly on the pillow in a way that forced Agatha to move her head."But kiss me, first."

Eagerly, Agatha had met not only the demand, but the permission as well. Rio was, as she knew she would be, a little on the grumpier side for about the first thirty minutes she was awake, especially in their rush to make sure they had everything they were going to need for the couple of weeks they were going to be away. Most of it had been pre-packed days before the wedding, but there were odds and ends that they scrambled around to secure before finally heading out the door.

The flight had been a long one, totaling over half of a day of travel time including the stop it took to refuel. As it turned out, there had been plenty of time to sleep, and even time left over to slip into that too-nice bathroom and indulge in the rush of what it was to be the in-love and horny couple they were.

Even if it could be considered inappropriate, Agatha never seemed to stop providing Rio with new experiences. Were they a little... uncaged sometimes? Maybe, but there had been plenty of other instances throughout the course of their relationship where Agatha had provided the same rush that had not involved them stripping down without the ability to keep their hands to themselves.

Agatha had taken Rio on her first horseback ride.

Agatha had given Rio the sights of LA at night from one of the tallest buildings in the city.

Agatha had been there when Rio's entire world was falling apart and so she'd put them on that very plane to get her home.

Agatha had proved to Rio very quickly that she would show her the world and thensome if it meant that Rio would be happy, that she would feel any good emotion over being tended to with so much love and compassion.

And Rio couldn't have loved her more for it if she tried.

Rio had fallen asleep with a couple of hours left in the flight. She was considerably less grumpy when Agatha gently nudged her awake, pressing a kiss to the space between her eyebrows.

"Look outside, my love,"She had coaxed, casting her eyes to the small round window to Rio's right.

Rio released a low grumble as she sat up, rubbing at her eye before she could shift her gaze to where Agatha had indicated. She scooted over a little so that she could see better and when the view outside became clear?

It took Rio a moment to process it, to understand that the bright white she saw for miles and miles as the plane lowered in its approach wassnow.A lot of snow.

Even though she had been entirely aware that she was going to be seeing snow for the very first time on that trip, actually seeing it stretched out in an expanse in that capacity was breathtaking and the idea that she would get to see it up close and personal excited her even further. There were some people who lived with it, who experienced it with frequency. Agatha had indicated such a history when she talked about growing up in eastern America, but Rio? Rio had known heat and sun and humid rain all of her life.

The moment the door of the jet opened and they stepped outside, the temperature nearly drew every bit of breath straight from Rio's lungs. It was a chill she had never known before, a coldness that seeped deep within her in only a matter of seconds. What she realized, though, was that it wasthrilling.

She had been nervous about how she would fare in such temperatures, but in those first few moments as they crossed the tarmac to their awaiting car, she had a feeling she might actually like it.

Rio's wonder had never left her as they drove towardReykjavik, Agatha's hand fastened tightly in her own as she stared out the window, the beauty of the glistening powder frequently leaving her feeling as though she were breathless. When she would turn to look at Agatha, that same wonder seemed to bubble up even more.

Agatha had taken the reigns in regard to planning this honeymoon and Rio had let her. She had been entirely too occupied by finishing her work project as well as trying to remain in her skin despite the anticipation toward their wedding day that had been trying to rip her clean out of it. Rio had never doubted her, and had been excited at the suggestion of Iceland, but something in Rio was already far too aware that every choice Agatha had made, she'd done so to put a smile on Rio's face.

Thus far, it was working.

In fact, it went far beyond that as they rolled through a small community of different cottages and homes, juxtaposed in strange ways based on the elevation of certain pieces of land that put some homes up higher than the others. When the pulled into the drive of one that had a lower placing, Rio's eyes lifted to the structure and for just a moment, they stung.

It was the only building like it, and while it did not look exactly the same, the angled and sharp features of the home Agatha had chosen for them to spend the next two weeks looked an awful lot like the one she'd bought them in New Zealand. There weren't as many windows -- much to Rio's disappointment -- but the appearance of the house with its geometrical design and pleated wooden exterior reminded her so fondly ofhome.

It was intentional. Of course it was intentional. Of course Agatha had come across this house in her planning and known that it was the right one. She was nothing if not sentimental and in those moments, Rio was so thankful for just how tender Agatha's heart could be sometimes.

"I didn't want you to get homesick with such a different climate,"Agatha supplied in a gentle murmur that graced Rio's ear with the proximity provided by how she leaned in over her shoulder.

"It's perfect, Agatha,"Rio responded, turning her head so that she could gift her wife a soft kiss.

The car rolled to a stop and Agatha thanked the driver, assuring him that she would add an additional tip via the app once they were inside. This compelled more assistance from him as he climbed out of the vehicle and helped them carry the majority of their things to the door. With another word of thanks, he departed and Agatha punched in a code above the door handle. There was the softest sound of whirring and then the click of the lock as it released.

Upon entering, Rio was utterly stunned by the beauty held within the interior of the home. It was clean and for every white surface in their own home, it was black in that one. Therewerelarge windows that had not been visible from their approach that cornered and met the far wall only in a break that housed a large and wide stone fireplace with a television mounted above it.

"This is... beautiful," Rio commented as she pulled the door shut once all of their belongings were inside.

"Let's take a tour," came Agatha's suggestion the moment she shed the coat she had donned when they'd arrived at the airport. After hanging it, she held out a hand for Rio's and did the same with it as well before she linked their fingers together and gave a tug of encouragement to lead them further into the home.

Agatha had already developed an idea on what it was going to look like, but each room was almost more breathtaking than the one before it. The kitchen was open and immaculate in its grey and black appearance, the lounge was contemporary but looked like a place they could spend many nights curled up on the couch relaxing and enjoying the first couple of weeks of married life.

There were four bedrooms, though the master had easily been Rio's favorite. The way the elongated windows let in just the right amount of light felt familiar and there was a sense of hominess that was induced by the floral artwork on the walls. They had returned downstairs, but Agatha was not done. Instead, she pulled on Rio's hand as she paced toward the back of the house.

Rio watched with mild curiosity as Agatha opened the sliding glass door and tugged her outside, beaming with a grin that wrinkled the corners of her eyes. Her hand flew out in indication, causing Rio's attention to turn.

There was a hottub.

Oh, Agatha was going to be absolutely rotten the next two weeks.

Rio was excited for it, nonetheless.

"I mean, I didn't go looking for it..." Agatha returned, though as she faced Rio, her still present grin had turned a bit sheepish. "But when I saw it was there, it was kind of the deal-sealer."

Rio laughed.

At this, Rio's eyes widened slightly. She knew exactly what Agatha was talking about.

They'd shared in a conversation about a month before the wedding about tattoos. Neither of them had any but, as they had discovered in the throes of their talk, they had both always wanted at least one. Agatha had not simply because she'd always had trouble with the idea of commitment and getting ink branded into her skin was a lifelong one. Rio had not because she was afraid she would not choose something with enough meaning.

They were going to get tattoos of origami flowers.

They had considered briefly the possibility of just going and doing it before the wedding, but it simply had not fit into their busy schedules in a way that would have worked for them. So... I also looked over her extensive portfolio before I called."

"I can't believe you're my wife."

Rio's exhausted grin was slow, but it eventually pushed her cheeks into peaks at hearing those words coming from Agatha's lips.

"You say that like you actually don't," Agatha poked back, cocking a brow in challenge.

It was the second time in mere hours that Agatha was asking Rio to let her shower her in the emotion that was clearly overflowing out of her. The restaurant Agatha had selected had been quaint and sweet, and Rio found herself with a developing yearning to study a bit about the Icelandic language. Most people they came into contact were kind enough to indulge them in speaking English, but in the moments where Rio could overhear a conversation at the adjacent table, or when they passed by?

It was fascinating, something that piqued her interest in a way few things did.

Agatha checked the time and then pulled out her phone, looking something up. Once she'd satiated her quest for knowledge, she stowed her phone and got to her feet. In a way Rio was all too familiar with, she held out her hand.

"We can walk to the shop. It's about eight minutes from here and the appointment is in fifteen," Agatha offered her the moment their hands were linked.

Even though it had been only an eight minute walk, Rio had loved every single minute there was to be hand. Iceland was so... different. It was in the way the snow piled in little spots at the edges of the streets. It was in the mostly white exteriors of so many of the buildings. There was a homey air about the section of the city they found themselves in and Rio could have found solace in the idea of just getting lost there.

She would make idle comments about a shop front, or how she wondered what a sign meant even though she couldn't read it. Agatha was steadfast by her side, the most contented curling of her lips seemingly frozen into her features.

When they had arrived at the tattoo shop and met the young woman Agatha had spoken to, Rio understood what Agatha had meant when she had called her delightful. Once they followed her back to her work area and she shared the design she had worked up for them, Rio had almost cried.

It would be no bigger than a few inches wide by a few inches tall, but it was almost an exact replication of the flower that Agatha had left on the houseboat her first night there. WhenSds had asked about color, Rio had been the first to volunteer her selection.

"Purple," she had said instantly, but then followed with only one qualifier. "A lighter shade preferred."

When the woman had turned her gaze upon Agatha, Agatha answered her so brightly that Rio couldhearthe love in such a response.

"As close to a hunter green as you can get. Not plussed if it swings a little one way or the other."

Sds disappeared for a few moments and returned with two copies of the stencil. Once it had garnered approval from both women, she had asked which of them would be going first and it had only taken the extra couple of seconds of Rio's hesitation for Agatha to take the plunge.

Sitting there next to her wife, feeling every single time Agatha's grip restricted around her hand as the woman on the other side of her carefully etched an important piece of their history into her skin, Rio couldn't have been more in love.

It was no secret that they were pretty close to the mid-way point in their lives. It was also no secret that meeting one another had instilled a youthful vibrance to their lives that they wanted to exist in forever. Maybe they were in their forties -- Rio tried not to point out the distinction after Agatha's 50th birthday earlier in the year because she quickly realized it was still taking some time to settle without being an irritation -- and getting their first tattoos, but so what?

Rio thought simply that she'd never had the reason or motivation to do so before. Now she had both.

"It's really not that bad," Agatha commented over half-way through the process. "Feels like being stung by a bee a lot."

Rio laughed, rolling her eyes. "You're not exactly being encouraging," she teased, bringing Agatha's hand up to kiss at her knuckles.

Toward the end, Agatha had gotten chatty. She had started talking about the kids, about wondering what they were doing. She rambled on about them hanging out with the Landons probably and how they would likely throw some kind of rager in their absence. That had been hilarious to Rio because they both knew that was the unlikeliest of all scenarios imaginable. It was just Agatha's way of chittering through the ache that had likely developed the longer the process wore on.

Sds leaned back and shut the machine off, setting it down to grab the bottle of soap that sat on her station. With a light squeeze, she wet Agatha's skin with it and gave a firm swipe of a paper towel over it. What was revealed the moment she completed the motion left Rio's eyes glassy even seeing it from the angle of where she was sitting.

It was beautiful. That origami flower, the same one Agatha had left her, but in Rio's color.

When she obtained the ability to tear her eyes from it, they swept up to Agatha who was already grinning at her.

"It's good?" she asked, clearly seeking affirmation.

"Very good. I love it." Rio glanced back down at it for a moment before meeting Agatha eye-to-eye again. She gave her hand a firm squeeze. "I loveyou."

Rio watched curiously as the artist applied a thin film over the fresh ink and explained what it was and how it worked. It was essentially like an extra layer of skin, one that would keep the tattoo protected from any irritants.

Agatha's first question had been so on brand for who she was at her very core and it had caused Rio to nearly choke on her laughter.

"Is it protective enough that I can get into... a body of water?"

The way she had asked it, coupled with Rio's laughter made the woman chuckle, too, just before she confirmed that yes, swimming with saniderm was acceptable.

In the time it took her to get her station cleaned up and re-prepped so that Rio could take her place next, she and Agatha had marveled at the ink on her body in the mirror. It was emotional in a way that Rio wasn't going to let herself feel in public, but she had been unable to help the way she turned Agatha's chin toward her so she could meet that familiar and warm gaze.

"I'm really glad we're doing this. I... I'm also really glad that you push me to do things I wouldn't normally choose for myself. Because... as it turns out, growing into the person that makes these choices is the same person that loves you for presenting them as options." Rio was being honest; she had spent so long isolated from personal growth in so many aspects of her life and it had limited her potential, potential that only ever could have been brought forth by the endless love Agatha had for her.

Next, it was Rio's turn.

They'd been placed side to side so thatSds could line up the placing evenly. Once she removed the paper from the stencil, Rio hadn't been able to keep herself from grinning at the way the two flowers looked next to each other on their hips, even before her own was actually imbued upon her skin.

Sds called them back over and Rio slid atop the same padded chair that Agatha had been in roughly twenty minutes prior. In turn, Agatha was at her side, both hands wrapped strongly around Rio's in her show of support.

The woman lifted her head and met Rio with a warm smile. "Are you ready?"

Wordlessly, Rio gave a nod and let her head rest against the padding on the chair behind her. When the other woman sensed that she exhaled the deep breath she'd taken, Rio felt it the moment the needle hit her skin.

It wasn't unbearable, but it was sharp and insistent. Immediately, she understood Agatha's need to have conversation to try and distract herself. Rio, on the other hand, remained rather quiet throughout the process, just watching the woman as she worked on her left hip, as opposed to Agatha's right.

She had been so quiet that Agatha had checked on more than one occasion that she was doing alright. Rio would roll her head over to look at her and meet her with the same sweet smile and an affirmation that she was okay. Agatha, all three times she asked, would simply lean in for a gentle kiss, another showing of solidarity.

In very similar motions,Sds finished and cleaned the new brand on Rio's skin, allowing them a look before she placed the saniderm over that one, as well. The moment they stepped in front of the mirror, hips bared to show their newly acquired art, Rio felt those emotionally driven tears as they coated the surface of her eyes.

They were beautiful. They were art. They were soAgatha and Rio.

Her head lifted to look at the woman by her side and for what felt like the millionth time in the last week alone, all she saw was every ounce of love within the confines of Agatha's body as it wrote itself across her face.

Agatha leaned toward her, pressing their lips together before she straightened back up. Her gaze never left Rio's though, and she finally spoke.

"Forever my soft place to land."

Rio knew one thing for absolute certain:

Agatha could not have been more correct about any other fact in the universe even if she tried.

Feet Can't Keep On the Ground

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

I can't stop time
 We keep blurring in my mind
 *****

"Estee is going to lose her mind. She's been trying to convince me to get a tattoo since the first one she got when she was eighteen," Rio divulged. She looked up from her bowl of skyr -- an Icelandic snack that closely resembled yogurt -- and berries to watch as Agatha dropped a handful of berries into hers as well from her place across the island countertop.

"I guess I'm just more convincing," Agatha returned with an unbothered shrug. It almost reeked of indifference and Rio knew that Agatha was not capable of such when it came to their family. This was proven true the moment her face nearly cracked in a grin, her eyes sparkling with her shenanigans.

"You're notwrong, but I think she'll understand anyway. I did mean it when I told her that I couldn't decide on something with enough meaning to force my hand," Rio tried to explain, as if Agatha would have formed any kind of disapproval anyway.

Agatha lifted her head and stuck her spoon in her mouth, upside down so that it cupped her tongue and at the same time, tilted her head to the side. The sight, as Rio took it in, was overwhelming in the most adorable and fulfilling way.

That washerwife. It washerwife that was standing there looking so impossibly cute that Rio had no fathomable way to deal with it.Rio'swife was the one who had arranged this entire honeymoon. They weren't even a full day in and Rio already thought it couldn't be any more perfect.

Agatha seemed to be struck by the look on Rio's face, enough so that she lowered the spoon, looking almost guilty.

"What is it?" she asked, her voice a gentle hum.

Rio was blinking, shaking her head of the haze she had allowed herself to slip into. An easy smile curled her lips.

"Just thinking about how much I love you," Rio answered, that airy and tender tone so warm as it floated across the space between them.

The moment it hit Agatha's ears, her shoulders dropped and she was grinning again.

"Well, then proceed. But don't forget the keep the audience informed. We love to hear it."

Agatha did and said these things sometimes, much like in that moment, where Rio couldn't help but wonder:How the hell am I the one standing here?

She was of the complete awareness that if she asked such a question out loud? Agatha would readily provide any and all answers without a moment's hesitation. Rio knew it would go as far back as her insane inclination to track down a stranger and could only ever evolve from there. It hadn't even been a full year since the day they'd met and yet, they had experienced so much. They had endured equally as much.

Instead of leaving her wanting, Rio formed a response.

"It's kind of like the idea that time is an illusion. In the same way, I think my capacity to love you is an illusion, too. Just... in the sense that there's no structure, no capability of confinement. Nothing can housethat muchfeeling on any plane of existence." The way Rio said it, it was like citing critical theory, but the contents and context of what she was trying to convey clearly struck Agatha straight in the chest.

Rio watched, almost in slow-motion as Agatha's expression melted like a popsicle on a hot summer's day, her eyes glassing over with the emotion such words had brought forth. As Rio began to try and justify what she had said, she realized she did not need to. Agatha was already moving, already whipping her way around that counter.

The moment she was close enough, Rio could sense it before she felt it, the comforting and familiar touch of Agatha's hand curling around the side of her neck. She turned her head the rest of the way just in time to catch Agatha's lips with her own, a deeply sentimental and emotional kiss that was still so light and careful.

There was something else there. Rio felt it. When Agatha pulled away, she saw it too.

There were clouds in those beautiful blue eyes, though the lightning had not yet begun to crackle.

Something wasn'twrong, but it didn't feelright, either.

Watching Agatha, even before her lips started worrying against one another, Rio sensed that there was something Agatha was holding onto. It felt like something that, for once, Rio did not already know.

"There's something I have to tell you... About yesterday..." Agatha disclosed, her voice low. Timid, almost.

Rio's expression pinched in uncertainty.

"As in... Our wedding day, that yesterday?" Rio questioned, tone laden with her confusion.

Agatha just nodded. The way she then looked over at her bowl, hesitating for just a moment before she let go of Rio's neck so she could lean across the island to grab it, it was this sudden shift in demeanor that Rio was trying to catch up with. Agatha looked back down at her and gave a tip of her head in indication that they should relocate to somewhere more comfortable.

Suddenly, Rio felt strange. She trusted Agatha implicitly... clearly. But it was like it was like Agatha had shifted from the highest gear to the lowest in the blink of an eye and it left Rio fumbling to sort it out.

What Rio did not understand was that what she had said and how she had said it had reminded Agatha that there was to be no stone left unturned in terms of how they communicated with each other.

She got to her feet and slipped one hand into Agatha's while cradling her bowl in the other, following a step behind her wife as they relocated to the living space, tucking into one of the large sofas there. For just a moment, Rio held her bowl in her lap. After that moment, she put it on the coffee table, having lost complete interest in it.

She brought up a leg to bend at the knee as she turned ninety degrees to face Agatha.

"Alright," Rio soothed, reaching for her hand again, giving it a firm squeeze. "This isn't like you... What's going on, my love?"

In that ever-so-classic Agatha way, her lips pressed together as those gears in her brain began to turn. "Do you..." she attempted, but her lips pressed shut again. "Do you remember when you, Dave, Jack and I were all talking... And I excused myself?" Agatha was looking down at their hands. She was not looking Rio in the eyes and Rio absolutely did not like that.

"Yes," Rio returned, though that wasn't the end of it. "But before you keep going, will you please look at me?"

Agatha's lips turned down at the corners so fast that it forced Rio to make a choice of her own. She let go of Agatha's hand and reached up, fingertips gracing her far cheek.Please,that soft and delicate touch seemed to shout,please look at me.

Rio was suddenly worried. What the hell could Agatha possibly be remembering that was upsetting her this deeply?

After a moment too long, Agatha finally turned her head. She lookedsoupset.

"Agatha..."

"I'm sorry I'm just now telling you... I should have said something last night, or even earlier today. I just... I wasn't thinking about it because I was so happy." Agatha's tone had wavered at first, but she seemed to find her resolve. As much as Rio loved her, the anxiety was beginning to win her over in the worst way. Thankfully, Agatha continued before it could sink her.

"My ex-husband showed up during the reception."

Okay, so Rio hadn't been expectingthat.

But... It made sense. It explained why Agatha was suddenly so perturbed, why she seemed so unsettled. Very rarely had Rio ever witnessed her in a state where it looked like she could have crawled out of her skin, but with such a deliverance, she understood every bit of it.

When Rio did not immediately askwhyAgatha hadn't told her, something settled in Agatha's deep azure gaze. What Riodidask caused that glassy film over them to return.

"And how did that make you feel?"

Agatha blinked at her for a moment, and by the fourth blink, a lone tear had rolled down her cheek.

Had she thought Rio was going to be angry? Had she thought that Rio would feel betrayed, or like Agatha had lied to her? What had she thought Rio's reaction would be? More over, why had she thought it would be anything other than compassion?

"I... It... It made me soangry."In spite of how quiet Agatha's voice was, Rio could hear that statement very clearly. It was an understandable feeling, something that made too much sense to have ever been anything else.

"And you handled it,"Rio affirmed. Her thumb began to move, creating the softest caress just below Agatha's eye."Do you want to talk abouthowyou handled it, or do you want to table this conversation for another time when you're not so upset with yourself?"

The confusion, this time, was Agatha's to wear. She had just dropped this huge bomb of a fact that she had not disclosed in their newlywed state, and there Rio sat, as patient and understanding as she ever was. It was because Rio knew that these things Agatha was telling her were facts.

Colton had shown up to their private wedding. It had made Agatha angry. Agatha had gotten him to leave.

Those were the facts.

Everything else, that was emotional kindling. Indulging those emotions when Agatha was already beating herself up would do neither of them any good. While Rio knew herself and her own ability to digest and comprehend, Agatha was still learning.

It had been nearly eight months; yes, they had covered a lot of ground and Rio could confidently say she knew no other human the way she knew Agatha, but there werealwaysgoing to be new things to discover. Maybe Agatha understood that she was going to be there, and truly mean it when she said it, but what she had yet to fully grasp was that Rio was just...sounderstanding, in the most true and raw form.

They would fight, yes, that was to be expected, but Rio would always be the kind of person who picked those battles wisely. Right then was not ever going to be the time to choose a fight. The last thing she was going to let happen was for the first night of their honeymoon devolve in any kind of fracture between them.

That was a lesson she was teaching Agatha on the spot. One that seemed to be sinking in.

"Can we talk about it later?"

In all their time together, Rio was almost certain she had never heard a question so small come from the woman she loved. All she could do to provide an answer was lean forward, kissing her softly.

"Of course, my love. Why don't we finish our snack and get ready for bed?"There was simply no way for Rio to be other than empathetic in those moment. She loved Agatha and she could see that she was clearly poking holes in herself to try and find a reason why she hadn't spoken up sooner, but Rio honestly could not have cared less.

Agatha was frustrated with herself because she'd let it slip her mind. Rio would never be angry because it had still been within forty-eight hours, give or take, that Agatha had brought it to her. They could discuss the implications later. For now, it was no longer sitting heavy on Agatha's chest.

Another moment of silence passed between them, but Rio's gentle touch on Agatha's cheek never stopped moving.

"You'remywife, huh?"Agatha breathed, tone and eyes both wondrous and filled with affection.

"Yes,"Rio whispered back in confirmation, leaning forward to kiss Agatha again. "And you'remywife. Which makes me the luckier of the two of us."

Agatha might have tried to roll her eyes and argue, but Rio kissed her in order to prevent that from happening. It was patient, it was understanding. It was permission to let it go for now. When Agatha moved, breaking the contact, her head turned enough that she could kiss Rio's cheek.

"I love you."Agatha sounded so honest, like she couldn't have been telling the truth more if she tried.

"I know you do. 'Cause, I may be insane for it,"Rio teased, a sly smile finding her face,"but I so wholly love you too."She pulled away and gave Agatha's thigh a loving pat and leaned forward to pick her bowl back up. She shifted to place her feet back to the floor and focused her energy on the food in front of her.

Rio had not missed the way Agatha pressed their hips closer together, the way she had soldiered the sides of their thighs together in a tight line, the way Rio could feel the lean muscle of Agatha's bicep as it nearly melted into her own.

Rio realized it wasfinallystarting to sink in to that thick skull of Agatha's. This was it. These were the first days of the rest of their lives and Rio was committed, full stop. It had become clear to Rio over the course of their relationship that no one else in Agatha's life ever could have managed something so grand, simply because Agatha would have never let them.

It could have only ever been Rio.

By the time they had finished, Rio rinsed their bowls and Agatha had gathered the bottle of champagne that had been left for them -- per Agatha's request -- in the refrigerator. Her free hand just barely brushed the small of Rio's back as she passed by in her quest to locate champagne flutes, causing the lightest sheet of goosebumps to flare over nearly every inch of her skin. Rio chuckled gently as she found them in the fourth cabinet she tried.

After draining over half the bottle in bed, Rio had found herself with her head on Agatha's stomach, a fingertip tracing a consistent line above the waistband of her sleep shorts, soft violet cotton bunched from the way she had it tied. She may have been touching that patch of skin, but it was only because she couldn't touch the one she wanted to be touching.

She wanted to know if it would feel different, to touch that inked part of Agatha's skin. Would she be able to feel the love that had been poured into the gesture? Would she be able to feel the intention there that tied them together for the rest of their lives? Or would it still feel like Agatha's skin, familiar and comforting?

Maybe it could be all of that at one time.

Between the jetlag, their mildly busy day, the champagne, and the crash from the adrenaline rush she'd gotten earlier in the day upon the beginning of the tattoo, Rio had fallen asleep in minutes once she had settled into that position.

Whilefallingasleep had been easy,stayingasleep had not.

Rio had woken up some time in the middle of the night, Agatha's arm draped over her middle from behind her. She was snoring soundly, clearly enjoying the deep sleep their exhaustion had brought with it.

She had thought, for about ten minutes, that she could go back to sleep. Ten minutes dissolved into thirty. Then they evaporated into an hour.

Rio was staring at the expanse of navy and purple sky that was painted on the other side of that window before her. It was too cold to go outside, but it was still breathtaking even with her head on the pillow inside that warm home.

It made her think.

It made Rio think about how big the world was. It made her think about the sheer randomness that had been the day she had met Agatha. It made her think about how downtrodden she had become in those following weeks. It made her think about what it had felt like at the foot of those stone steps as Agatha had run straight into her to kiss her for a second time.

It made her think how, in contrast, it felt to kiss her in front of fifty other people who cheered them on and supported the love that they had.

Oh, how far they had come.

One hour became two. Then, the sun came up. Rio had thought of so many things, from the way their phones had been put on do-not-disturb to wondering how the kids were doing and almost wanting to know bad enough that she was willing to break that do-not-disturb rule they had made.

She had stayed in bed, cuddled with her sleeping Agatha, for as long as she could manage. Her bones grew restless eventually and she carefully pulled herself out of bed, doing her best to not wake her wife.

In one of Agatha's t-shirts and her boy short underwear, Rio made her way downstairs and made a cup of coffee using the Keurig that the home had been furnished with. Twenty minutes later, she made another. By the end of the third cup, she found herself thinking about one thing.

It wasn't just the tattoo. It wasn't even the symbolism of the origami flowers.

It was what had been written inside.

It was how that very note was still with her everywhere of importance she went. Currently, it was tucked inside the pages of the copy of The Tenth Circle by Jodi Picoult she had picked up a few weeks prior.

Where Rio stayed, that note stayed. It was forever a reminder of the way Agatha saw her, and would always see her.

By 9 am, Rio had retrieved the card they had been given the day before as well as her book and returned to the kitchen. She typed out a short but succinct email to the tattoo artist and asked if she had anything available that day. She also added in the photo of what she wanted, exactly, in the form of that post-it note as it laid on the counter. It had taken only twenty minutes for a response, one that held the promise of an early afternoon cancellation.

Rio had snatched it up.

The appointment time was set for noon; that gave her enough time to shower, get ready, order a car and make the trip into town. If she could slip out before Agatha woke up, she might be able to buy herself a little bit of time. So, she set about the steps it would take to get from point a to point b and by the time her hair was dry and she was dressed, her mildly fiendish side was excited that Agatha was still on her stomach, face half buried in her pillow.

Kneeling on the edge of the bed, Rio leaned over, pressing the lightest kiss to Agatha's cheek and giving her shoulder a gentle shake at the same time. It took a couple of seconds but the sounds of consciousness rumbled out of her with a soft groan.

"I'm going to get us lunch, my love,"Rio told her, placing one more kiss just below Agatha's temple."Go back to sleep."

Agatha's dissatisfied grumble came back immediately.

"But I can go with you,"she tried to reason. Rio's immediate response was the softest gracing of laugher in the form of a breathy chuckle against Agatha's skin, which she explained a moment later.

"You are exhausted. Get the sleep while you can. You're not getting off as easy tonight,"Rio offered in a faux threat.

Agatha easily took it as such, her lips sliding back in a sleepy smile."Promise?"

"Cross my heart."One last kiss, a physical wave of goodbye before the verbal one came."I love you. I'll be back soon."

"I love you too. Be careful. And don't bring back that weird fish stuff."

Despite the fact that Rio had been trying to keep her volume on the lighter side, the laughter that spilled out of here was almost enough to shatter the stillness of the room. Agatha didn't seem to care. Her smile just grew as she burrowed a little deeper into the comfort of her pillow, looking every bit the angel Rio thought her to be.

Rio departed and made her way downstairs to finish preparing for her little solo journey. When she peered out the small window next to the door, she was tickled to see that the car was already at the end of the drive, waiting for her. She pulled on the coat that she knew she would only ever need for this trip and fastened it up, lifting the faux-fur hood over her head to keep any chill away.

The drive, as she had known it would be, was short, and the moment she opened the door to Moonstone for the second time in twenty-four hours,Sds lifted her head from whatever she was working on to greet Rio with a grin.

"No compatriot today?" she offered lightly, pushing herself to her feet.

Rio shook her head, though her bright grin was mischievous. "I told her I was getting lunch. This one is a surprise for her."

"She's the one who wrote it?" the other woman asked back, the sentiment clearly not lost on her.

"She did, the first day we met. I found it a few days later after I thought I would never see her again. And now, here we are!" Rio explained, though she had to fight the urge not to laugh at how ridiculous it sounded even coming from her lips in a simple explanation. "It's actually what she used for the flower that gave us the idea for yesterday."

"Oh my god, stop. Caked in Gold, Run for the Setting Sun

What she had not been expecting was for the way Agatha's hand would snake down her forearm, at several different points so that she could brush her fingertips, or the pad of her thumb, just around the outer edge of the sealed saniderm on Rio's wrist. After the fifth time it happened during the two hour film, Rio understood it.

It was doing exactly what she had intended for it to do. It was the best way Rio could have found to instill such a deep sentiment and she could see that it was having that very effect. Agatha found comfort in it. That was ultimate reward.

"We can start it earlier tomorrow, my love. Plus, this pizza place has... pepperoni and blue cheese pizza? Not a combination I've ever considered in my forty years of life, but... When in Iceland?" Rio posed, the sound of her grin ringing so brightly in her tone.

It was something she had heard hundreds, if not thousands, of times before and she knew it would be something she heard a million more, but in that very second, it was the most beautifully pure sound in the world.

She could have, if dinner weren't a little more pressing.

"That's because you're willing to try anything once," Rio countered, raising her eyebrows in challenge.

Meeting it instantly, a steep grin curled Agatha's lips as her eyes flickered from Rio's face to the back door. The hot tub didn't have to be in the line of sight for Rio to know exactly what she was referring to without having to say a thing. "You're trying to tell me youhaven'ttried thatat least oncealready?" Rio asked, her jaw dropping the slightest bit in her mock disbelief.

Agatha's expression puckered sourly and then her lips curled downward. "I didn't actually expect you to call me out on it. And it wasn't a hot tub, it was a pool."

A delighted and deep laugh immediately hit the air as it dove from Rio's lips. "My love, there are very few things within reason in this world that I would be truly shocked to learn you have not partaken in. After all..." Rio paused the same moment she submitted their dinner order. She held that pause as she lowered the phone to the counter and shifted so that she was perpendicular to Agatha, hip pressed to the edge. She leaned a little closer, her lips tauntingly close to Agatha's, so much so that she could have easily closed the distance, but she did not. "If I recall correctly, you let me pin your bare back to a floor-to-ceiling window in your office. Old man with his binoculars and all."

With a statement like that, Agatha quickly proved that she had no desire to keep space between them. With a quickness, she shifted to the side so that their lips could touch. "Yes, I did," Rio conceded almost instantly, chest deflating with a soft sigh. "But I also can see that there is another home right over there," she indicated, waving a pointed finger behind her. "And... By my brief mathematical calculations based on the elevation of that home and the height of that fence... If they happen to come outside and we have the back light on..."

"And?" Agatha prodded, that smirk seeming to only grow the longer Rio verbalized her train of thought.

"And they could see us! Without binoculars!" Rio pressed, though her voice hiked nearly an entire octave the moment she said it.

"Annnnnnd?" Agatha pressed harder, smirking even wider.

"Agatha!" Rio returned sharply, though the expression she was wearing was torn between being entirely amused and also slightly shocked. "I will absolutely enjoy some relaxing and unwinding time in the hot tub with you, but no funny business! We do not need to get arrested in Iceland for indecent exposure. Our children would never let us hear the end of it," she added, attempting to appear menacing as she tipped her head forward.

Agatha's lip popped out for just a moment in a pout before it withdrew and she offered a shrug.

"It's not like they'd be surprised," Agatha offered airily, finding that sense of feigned indifference again. And again, it made Rio laugh.

"Maybe not, but that's exactly why we would never hear the end of it." Just as they were relocating, the doorbell sounded and their dinner had arrived.

It was a sense of belonging, a sense that while they had been paving their path jointly before, they got to do it solely for them for the time they were in Iceland. Hearing these things that Agatha had planned, it was fulfilling in its own way, in a way that told Rio just how well Agatha knew her and knew the things she would want to experience while they were there.

The marker on that roadmap that Rio kept coming back to was going to the observation center to see the Borealis later on that week.

Having spent the majority of her life in the southern hemisphere, the Northern Lights were little more than a myth to Rio, something she had only ever been able to see photos of. The moment Agatha had booked it, she knew she was helping Rio reach dreams she'd never even knew she had.

Riohaddone all of those things. It had made no sense at the time, and she knew she wouldn't have if it hadn't been for the push from Estee, but she had still done them. Rio still made those choices, did all of those things for a stranger because she knew in the core of who she was as a human that she needed to. Maybe it had been far beyond her comprehension at the time, but as she laid there listening to the beating heart of the woman she could not love any more if she tried, she knew that everything she had done had been the right thing to do.

She got to call Agatha hers because of each and every one of those things.

"So..." Agatha began, lifting her head and snuggling back into the pillows. "Sds and I got to talking while she was stabbing me in the neck..." Even before Rio picked her head up off of Agatha's chest to look at her, she could hear the brightness of her grin. It was even more beautiful when Rio adjusted so that she could take in such a sight.

"She mentioned there's a really nice bar called... Andpleasedo not kill me because I know I'm absolutely going to fuck this up...Monkey'sKokteilbarinn --"Before she could finish, Rio's face had already cracked and her laughter spilled out of her not at the pronunciation, but rather the amount of effort Agatha put into genuinely trying to not fuck it up. "...You know what, I said 'don't kill me' not 'don't laugh.' Left myself open for that one. Anyway! She asked if we would like to join her and her girlfriend for drinks tonight."

Rio's eyes widened slightly in surprise. With some thought, it made some sense. They'd been in together and the interaction had been pleasant, but surely in her one-on-ones with each of them, she had learned different things about them, and about the way the other saw them. In those instances,Sds had very obviously felt a kinship that she wanted to explore a little more.

"Agatha..." Rio trailed, as if her disbelief was too strong to let her process. Before she could speak again, her smile reached her eyes. "Are we makingfriends?!"

With a playful roll of her own eyes, Agatha's joy sprung to life in her features.

"I think we just might be, my love."

Rio watched her for just a moment before learning forward, taking a light kiss. As she placed herself back where she was safely under Agatha's hold and head on her shoulder, that curling of her lips could not seem to stop.

"Our first friends together. I mean... That we don't already know individually. It feels... momentous." There was an appreciation in such a statement. There was a value to it in the way that it was a new experience, something they were doing together for the first time. As wives, they were moving about the world in a way that garnered them companionship in a platonic sense, outside of their own romantic bond.

"Because it is," Agatha returned softly, this time the one to take a gentle kiss. She kept it light and brief, but Rio could still see the softest dusting of pink across her cheeks when she broke it to lean back into the pillows again.

"She said she closes up at 7 tonight and then would need to go home to change. We exchanged numbers and I told her I would text her with a definitive answer once I talked to you about it." The arm that Agatha had wrapped around Rio's frame was strong, but the way her fingertips traced over Rio's arm -- half over her sleeve and half over her skin in an up and down motion -- was so very soft. "So... What do you think?"

"I think I would quite like to go have drinks with some new friends," Rio stated decidedly, the excitement slowly seeping into her tone with each word.

"Well, that gives us about five hours to do... Whatever we want with!" Agatha was stating it as an option invitation, and Rio knew she could have made absolutely any suggestion and Agatha would have been open to it. Right then, Rio's beguiling was much softer than the wilder ideas she could have entertained.

"Can we just stay like this for a little while?"

Agatha's answer came easily.

"Of course, my love."

And so, they had. Rio had been too comfortable there nestled against Agatha's side to want to go anywhere else. They had talked about their tattoos, the fact that they should eat something before they met withSds and her girlfriend, about how Iceland was already providing quite an experience and they hadn't done all that much up to that point. They also discussed breaking their do-not-disturb rule to message the kids to check in, but once Agatha pointed that they would likely get hassled and told to stop worrying about them, they put a pin in the idea to revisit in a few days when the sense of missing them was a little stronger.

When Agatha had suggested they shower, Rio's own belief was that they should really have a reason for one, which Agatha had caught onto immediately. The way she had moved so easily, rolling over to lightly pin Rio to the bed, it was both laughter-inducing and impossibly sexy.

Being intimate with Agatha was easy because Rio trusted her without question. Even though Rio felt such a way, she was also incredibly disgruntled when she had gone to kiss her favorite spot on Agatha's neck and Agatha had pulled away in reenforcement.

"I have another side," Agatha had reminded her.

So Rio gave it a shot.

She was wholly dissatisfied.

"You don't make the same noise!" Rio had grumbled, but then immediately resumed kissing the foreign space thereafter.

Such a qualm came up the two additional times that Rio had gone to that spot out of mere habit to be met with distance.

Agatha likely realized it was something she would be hearing several times over the following weeks. The way she lit up every time despite Rio's annoyance stated very apparently that it would be fine with her each instance it happened.

By the time they were both satisfied and slick with sweat, there had been little argument from Rio when it came to showering. It was one of her favorite things to do with Agatha that was still so incredibly intimate without being overtly sexual. Sure, there were times itwasovertly sexual, but showering together had become a deep comfort for Rio throughout the course of their relationship.

It was because she remembered was it was like to strip herself bare that very first time and present herself, completely void of any defenses, to Agatha. She remembered the tenderness, the softness that Agatha had exhibited the first time she had washed Rio's hair, gently scrubbed her body.

The beautiful thing about it was that those things were still present each time they stepped under the stream of water that was produced from any showerhead in any bathroom they were ever in. It didn't matter if it was in LA, or Auckland, or Reykjavik. Wherever they were, whenever they entered that state of vulnerability, they were always going to tend to one another with the utmost respect.

That was never going to change.

Wrapped in towels shortly after, the were stationed on their respective sides of the room, rifling through clothing to decide what to wear for their evening out with their new acquaintances.

"Argh!" Agatha cried, tossing a blouse aside, the disdain for the task at hand clear in the sound of her voice.

"My love? Are you alright over there?" Rio questioned, glancing over her shoulder to see Agatha on her knees, ripping things out of her suitcase.

"I don't know what to wear!" she cried back in frustration.

Rio considered this for a minute.

"Want to continue our tradition?" Rio asked softly, straightening up from her own search so that she could turn and pace toward Agatha, placing a light hand on her bare shoulder, giving it a light squeeze.

"Our tradition?" Agatha returned, confused as she lifted her chin to look up at Rio.

"Well, it's not a tradition yet, but it can be. You let me pick your dress for the wedding. What if... For dates and big events, we do it then too?"

After a moment of thought, the understanding slowly melted into Agatha's expression. She seemed to consider the idea, and possibly even the implications of it.

Dressing oneself was a fact of human life. It was something everyone did every single day to present themselves to the world. What Rio was offering right then was a mutual understanding and trust. Not only that, but it was centered in the same intention that it had been when it had come up in reference to their wedding attire.

Rio knew what looked best on Agatha and what suited the image she wanted to present to the world.

Agatha knew the exact same thing when it came to Rio.

If such an offer could alleviate the stress of not being able to make a decision, wasn't it worth contemplation?

"I'm not wearing a dress tonight," Agatha informed her, tilting her head back a little more so that those blue eyes met Rio's own green ones. "I didn't even pack one."

"Which means you packed suits instead?" Rio questioned, her lips curling into a delighted smile. When Agatha nodded, Rio clapped her hands in excitement. "Perfect! Let me in there. You go over there and find me something cute, hm?"

She gave a light squeeze to Agatha's shoulder, a silent request for compliance. Wordlessly, Agatha rose to her feet, turning so they were face-to-face.

"How do youdothat?" Agatha asked her. While there was astonishment in the sound of her voice, there was something else on her face, something in those eyes as they bored into Rio's, giving her that sensation she had never really stopped feeling since she met Agatha. It was the one where it was like Agatha was able to look right through her.

"You know, I used to ask you that same question all the time. I only stopped because I don't think there will ever be an answer, my love."

Rio meant it.

The answer to that question was simply that there was no answer at all.

There was no combination of words in any written language that could summarize that connection, that mutual understanding that ran between them.

Realizations like that, they were almost enough to push Rio to those spirals of contemplating existentialism, of wondering how something so vast could still be so true. There were things in the world that were solid, and Rio knew their love was one, but at the same time, it could not be contained.

How could she, a mere mortal, be capable of such multitudes?

How could they, as a couple, possess the abilities they did when it came to what they felt for one another?

Rio knew the logic there would never exist and that had to be good enough. She had to find solace in it or lose herself in a spiral of beingtooself-aware. Her present was comfortable, enough that it pushed her to keep that from happening.

Rio tilted forward, pressing a kiss to the corner of Agatha's mouth before giving her a light nudge to encourage her to set about her task. When she obliged, Rio dove into her own a.k.a. Agatha's suitcase. It took her a grand total of a minute to locate what she wanted, about halfway down on the right side.

It was a very dark blue suit, so dark it was almost black. There were the smallest eggshell stripes that ran down the entire length. Even with the way it was folded as she lifted it out, she knew exactly what Agatha looked like when she put it on. Pleased with that decision, she set to her next marker of deciding what to pair with it. After another moment of rummaging, she had procured a turtleneck roughly the same color as the pinstripes on the suit, a triumphant grin winding up her lips.

As she got to her feet, Agatha spoke from behind her, presenting her with a question she hadn't anticipated.

"Do I get to do your hair too?"

In a flash, Rio was so warm that she was certain she'd turned at least six different shades of red. She was simply so taken by it, by the way Agatha had asked such a thing. Rio shuffled over, cradling her selection in her arms as she tried to peer over Agatha's shoulder to see what she was looking at. Before she could catch a glimpse, Agatha waved a hand to ward her off.

"And why do you want to do my hair, my love?" she inquired.

As if to answer her question, Agatha held up the cream colored knit sweater she had been ruminating on. To elaborate, she spoke. "I really like the cut of the neckline on this, and Ireallylike the way your neck looks when you have your hair up when you wear it." She turned her head enough that she could see Rio, that look in her eyes requesting confirmation.

Rio had no opposition to such an ask, she was just still recovering from the tenderness of such a request, even if there was an ulterior motive behind it.

"Yes, Agatha, you can pull my hair up for me."

The softest growl of triumph came from low in Agatha's throat, almost a chuckle but not quite.

Rio floated toward the bed, laying her choice atop the corner of the bed and turned around in time to see Agatha get to her feet. In addition to the sweater, she was holding a pair of black skinny jeans in her other hand, radiating with pride at the selection she had made.

When Agatha's eyes dropped to the bed, Rio's bounty splayed out and waiting, her lips immediately parted in the wide showing of teeth that expressed how much it tickled her.

"You know me so well. I... Probably would have thought it too much and passed on to something else. So... thank you."

Rio approached, sneaking a quick peck as she took the clothing from Agatha's hold and they set about preparing for the evening ahead of them. It took little over a half an hour by the time they were both dressed and presentable, Rio there in her sweater and jeans with her hair pulled back into a ponytail and Agatha in her not-quite-casual suit, hair straightened as it cascaded down her back.

Oh, the mismatched pair that they were.

And yet, they made so much sense.

Venturing into the city, they had stowed away in a little noodle shop, enjoying a quick bit while they waited forSds to text Agatha that they were heading to the bar. The conversation had been typical for them; it was giggle inducing, airy and wholesome. It amazed Rio, really, that they simply seemed to never run out of things to talk about. She could get used to a life like that with Agatha, no questions asked.

As they were cleaning up their area, Agatha's phone dinged from its poisition on the table. With little effort, she scooped it up and opened the message. She took a moment to type back a short response and then locked the phone again, that dazzling smile filling her face as she informed Rio that the other pair were on their way to the bar and that with a ten minute cab ride, they would get there at roughly the same time.

Agatha had been right.

When Rio placed her hand into Agatha's and climbed out of the car, bothSds and her girlfriend were standing just to the left of the entrance, wide smiles on their faces. They were an adorable pair, really.Sds was taller, her blonde hair curled in loose ringlets that wove into the fur on the collar of her coat. Her cheeks were pink from the cold and those bright honey eyes shimmered in the lights overhead. Holding her hand, her girlfriend was a good four or five inches shorter with shoulder length dark hair that fell straight over her collar. There was a silver hoop in her right nostril and from the way she was smiling as they approached, Rio could see the small silver horseshoe that sat beneath her top lip, hanging to the very top of her teeth.

That's cute as fuck,Rio caught herself thinking. Before her mind had the chance to run away with her, the two stepped forward,Sds offering a hand to Agatha who shook it firmly.

"It's great to see you both again,"Sds offered, her tone light and sweet. After she shook Rio's hand, too, she made the introduction that needed making. "Agatha, Rio, this is my girlfriend Elfa. Elfa, Agatha and Rio."

"Pleasure to meet you," Agatha greeted, giving her hand a strong shake.

When the other woman turned to Rio, something overtook her. It was something that did not allow her to filter what transferred from her brain and fell out of her mouth. It was almost like she were possessed, unable to keep herself from speaking.

"That's a beautiful name," she started, but it was the follow-up that she probably should have tossed aside. "What does it mean?"

The moment Elfa spoke, Rio knew exactly why she had asked such a question.

"It means 'river,'" she answered back with pride, a bright smile on her face.

It was cold out, sure, but that wasn't the reason Rio felt a sheet of goosebumps skate across her skin. Still, the chill did not keep the excitement from filling her entire face, smile wide and full.

"Mine, too."

There was this little bubble around the four of them for just those couple of introductory moments that was so very cozy and comforting. Yes, they were thousands of miles away from anywhere they would have called home. However, just those first few moments of small talk felt like they actually belonged there, not just as some aimless pair of tourists, but as people who respected the culture and simply wanted to learn from it and experience it for themselves.

After a couple of minutes, the four of them migrated inside and took seats at the bar. Agatha placed a finger to the drink menu that laid at the far side of the bar and pulled it to rest between them, flipping it open just as she flashed a grin at Rio. As they both looked down at it, they erupted into laughter.

It was all in Icelandic.

Such an idiot move, but one that caused the other two women to join in the chorus of jovial sounds.

"We do not mind translating,"Sds offered, pulling forward a menu of her own so that she could survey the options. "Any alcohol preference?"

"Not gin."
"Not gin."

The moment Rio and Agatha spoke at the same time, the other two women first blinked and then fell prey to amused giggles, just watching the two of them.

"Okay," Elfa gushed, leaning her cheek against her fist on the bar, "that was damn adorable."

OnceSds had regained her bearings, though the corners of her eyes were still wrinkled from the way her cheeks were lifted, she glanced back down at the cocktail menu. "That takes the Robot Chicken, Singapore Sling and Basil Gin Fizz off the table. If you're not opposed to mezcal, I highly suggest the Naked and Famous."

As though it were a knee-jerk reaction, Rio snorted from her position on the other side of Agatha. She raised a hand to her mouth, trying to temper the reaction but the night before in the hot tub so very quickly flashed through her mind.

In her own snappy response, Agatha's hold jutted down to anchor to Rio's thigh, giving it a tame squeeze that asserted Agatha could sense exactly what was running through her mind. Catching such a hint, Rio tried to quell the intensity of her grin, but her quip found its way out nonetheless.

"Sounds exactly like something you'd like," she divulged, but managed to keep the humored tremble from taking her over.

"I don't know if I'm feeling it tonight," Agatha returned, though she did not seem to mean it as any kind of double entendre that was defensive in any regard toward Rio's light teasing. "What about... Vodka?"

"Hm,"Sds huffed in thought, dragging her fingertip down the length of the menu and back up again. "For vodka, there's the usual suspects... Martini, Cosmopolitan, Monkey's Mule... There's a Frozen Pornstar Martini?" Even she could not get through that one without chuckling, though Rio had gained the sense that this was not the other couple's first time there.

"Anything rum wise?" Rio questioned, leaning forward a little on her elbows for peer down the bar at the woman holding the menu.

"Mai Tai and mojito are your only options, sadly,"Sds responded. "But! They do have several wine selections and the Icelandic beers they have on draught are delightful."

Rio's gaze shifted to Agatha who looked over at her, almost reading her mind.

"You want a side car, huh?" Agatha teased, giving Rio's thigh a light squeeze at the same time.

"I do. But I suppose I can settle for a mojito. It won't kill me," came Rio's response, her hand dropping to slide overtop Agatha's so that she could grip it gently.

They'd placed the order for their drinks, whichSds and Elfa assured they were covering for the evening. Agatha had tried to put up some form of protest, butSds hadn't backed down. She had insisted that it was a simple gesture of kindness that came with well wishes for a healthy and successful marriage, not hesitating to include that they had branded themselves for one another not once, but twice, using her hand to do so.

It had been funny, watching Agatha try to drive a bargain that she was never going to win. Rio was fascinated, watching as Agatha operated with that usual finesse trying to commandeer the situation as she might have under any other circumstance, butSds put up a valiant effort. Honestly, Rio was impressed.

Once they collected their drinks, Elfa had been the one to suggest they relocate to a booth so that it would be easier to share in conversation as opposed to leaning over the bar to try and shout at each other, especially Rio and Elfa who capped the ends.

Over the next hour or so, the drinks kept coming and the chatter never stopped. The two natives shared local stories and ideas of things to see in their time there. Agatha, who had left room for something like this to come up, had taken notes, pulling a couple of things up on her phone to bookmark so that she could look into them later.

They talked about sledding sites to visit only after Rio admitted that she was nowhere near ready to learn how to snowboard or ski. Between Agatha,Sds, and Elfa, they hadnearlywon her over on the idea of going ice skating. As that conversation seemed to draw to a close, Agatha glanced up, leaning toward the opening of the booth as if she were looking for something.

"Looking for the ladies?"Sds asked, raising an indicatory pointer finger over Agatha's shoulder. "Down there and to the right."

Agatha gave a nod of thanks and leaned over to place a soft kiss to Rio's cheek as she excused herself.

Rio finished her third drink and admittedly, she was a bit past the point of being buzzed and was toeing the line of being actually drunk. One more would likely do it, but before that could happen,Sds -- sat directly across from Rio -- had something that she could no longer seem to bite back.

"You know," she began, tracing the rim of her glass in front of her with a couple of fingertips, "we don't get a lot of famous faces around here, much less in the shop."

Ah, and here Rio thought they were flying under the radar.

"So youdoknow," came Rio's smooth response, but her lips were curling before she finished speaking.

"When I said I was a writer, what I did not say was that I was a screen writer," Elfa revealed as she leaned back into the booth,Sds' arm falling easily around her shoulders. "I have personally never had the pleasure, obviously, but I have contacts who have brushed elbows."

"But..." Rio started, her brow furrowing the slightest bit. "Neither of you said anything..."

"Because,"Sds voiced this time, tilting her head in a comforting and friendly manner, "that isn't why you're here. You're here to celebrate the newness of your marriage and your very clear love for one another. Those are the people we wanted to befriend."

For the briefest skip out of time, Rio found herself in one of those moments where the complexities of the human condition were so obvious there in front of her face. They had spent their time traveling from continent to continent and surely, at least one person they crossed paths with knew who Agatha was. Maybe they made it known on occasion, maybe they didn't. To hear that kind of a sentiment as it was delivered so freely by someone Rio could -- drunk or not -- actually consider a friend after only a couple of days, it instilled that deep softness in her chest.

"Plus, she got the rundown on the the woman who tamed the Wild Witch of Hollywood from Agatha herself this morning, but we wanted to get to know you more ourselves." Elfa's amusement was clear in her pretty green eyes, but it was what she said that snagged Rio's attention.

"'The Wild Witch of Hollywood?' Is that like... A widely known thing?" Rio probed, leaning forward a little, torso slightly hovering above the tabletop in her tipsy state.

"Well, kind of. Wild because of her consistent TMZ appearances with various women for... several years. Witch because... Well, she rules with an iron fist. Anyone in the industry knows that."Sds was gentle in her delivery, both knowing that it could be a sensitive topic but also wanting to answer Rio's questions honestly.

Rio let this settle for a moment, wishing she had another drink. She knew that she and Agatha had been very different people in their lives before their paths had crossed. Where Rio had chosen to isolate in the struggles life had dealt her, Agatha had done the exact opposite. Agatha had been honest with Rio about that much. It wasn't so much that she was surprised, or even upset by the mention, it was just the sudden weight of realizingjust how muchAgatha truly did love her. She had stowed away years of conquests and physical relationships because she had chosen to commit herself to Rio. It was that simple and yet, it still felt so impossibly complex.

Agatha had wielded her reputation like a weapon for so very long, one that people on other continents were even aware of. Now, they were aware that the only face Agatha had been seen with on TMZ in almost a year was Rio's.

Elfa reached for her drink -- the vibrant green having faded with the way the ice had melted -- and took a sip, thinking for a moment before she spoke. "She still carries that intimidating air, but it's very clear that you are her soft spot, and that she loves you."

"And the wedding looked gorgeous,"Sds added.

At the same time she dropped the compliment, Agatha slid back into the booth, her hips nestling flush against Rio's. This distraction probably served well because it did not allow time for Rio to question that someone she did not know had just brought up the appearance of their very private wedding ceremony where they had been rigid in their request that photos not be posted until they were ready.

Ignorance was bliss, perhaps.

"What did I miss?!" Agatha asked animatedly in a way that informed Rio she, too, was feeling the alcohol. Neither of them stopped Elfa from flagging down a waitress and requesting one more round, though.

"I learned something new," Rio divulged. A thrilled smirk twisted its way up her lips as her hand came to rest on Agatha's thigh, fingertips digging playfully into the muscle there. "My Wild Witch."

For just a moment, Agatha's eyes went so wide Rio was tipsily concerned that they were going to fall out of her head.

"My love," Rio crooned soothingly as she leaned into her wife, pressing her lips to Agatha's cheek. "It was a different life. But... It's got a nice ring to it."

She could feel there next to her as the tension eased out of Agatha, her posture slackening a little.

"Wow, I'm gone for five minutes and you two just throw me under the bus? Thanks a bunch," she shot across the table, but she was smiling. Sure, it probably startled her a bit, but she knew it was never going to be something Rio held against her. "And here I thought I'd managed to go incognito."

The waitress returned with their drinks and Rio couldn't help the soft snickering that escaped her at the way Agatha had nearly downed half of hers in one go before nearly slamming it back on the table. She was clearly a little flustered, though Rio maintained both the closeness of how they sat as well as the hold she had on Agatha's thigh.

With a little more back and forth, they had finished their last round of drinks and the other women declared that they should probably retire for the evening. Although they had no responsibilities, Rio knew that she and Agatha were probably intoxicated enough that returning to their little corner of the world was likely a smart choice for them, too.

In a comical showing of tripping out of the booth and trying to put their coats on, the four women finally made their way out of the bar and into the bitterly cold night air to hail cabs. The first one had rolled to the curb and Rio and Agatha both agreed the other women could take it.

Before they loaded into the back, bothSds and Elfa wrapped them each in a warm embrace.

"Blessu to you both,"Sds voiced as she released Rio from their hug. "And if you decide to go ice skating..." Her eyes drifted to Agatha and her drunken grin sparkled in the streetlights. "You have my number if you'd like company."

Agatha offered a kind smile and a nod in return. "Oh, absolutely. If I can get blades on her feet, I would like as many witnesses as I can get." This earned her a gentle elbow from Rio as it landed in her middle, a softoofpassing through her lips.

"Goodnight, ladies. Thank you for spending the evening with us." AsSds finished speaking, the two of them each offered a wave and folded into the back seat of their cab before it rolled off. This allowed for Agatha to hail another while she cradled a drunk Rio beneath her arm against her chest.

"Wanna know a secret?" Rio murmured against the smooth fabric of Agatha's coat, her voice higher pitched but soft in volume.

"Yes, my love, I would love to know a secret," Agatha answered, though a inebriated giggle tumbled from her lips shortly after. She waved her hand again, finally catching the attention of an oncoming car that pulled to the curb, clearly marked.

"I love you the most out of everything in the whole wide world."

Agatha shifted slightly so that she could help Rio into the car, though she had not missed the confession. Instead, she waited until they were situated in the back seat of the car to make her response.

Rio settled against Agatha's side, eyes sliding shut contenedly as Agatha's answer rumbled softly out of her.

"I'll keep that secret on the condition that you keep mine."

"Yeah?" Rio lifted her head a bit to look at her wife, her expression mildly curious. "And what's your secret?"

Agatha's hand lifted so that she could drag a fingertip down between Rio's eyebrows to the tip of her nose, giving the bulb a soft tap.

"That I love you more than that," Agatha told her, honest but knowing the response it would draw. And she was right.

"Hey! Absolutely not!" Rio responded, her face scrunching in a pout.

"I dunno... How could we find out?" Agatha teased, cocking an interrogatory brow at the exact same moment a devilish smirk curled her lips.

"Oh, I will show you the second we get back!" Rio assured her, though her pout had come to rest somewhere between a scowl and a frown.

Agatha's smirk deepend and grew a shade more wicked.

"Oh, please tell me that's a promise."

"It's one hundred percent a promise!" Rio assured her defiantly, a little too drunk to realize she had just played right into Agatha's hand.

"Perfect."

Make Your Jaw Drop

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

You make me feel so fuckin' pretty
 Take loving me to a new extreme
 If I can't have you, I don't want no one.
 *****

"No, no no no!Agatha!It's seven, four, two,nine," Rio corrected, her weight tipping just enough that the only reason she hadn't fallen over was Agatha stood there next to her, trying to punch in the code to the front door for the third time.

For the third time, the numbers flashed red and the lock refused to whir.

"What the fuck?!" Agatha shouted, her frustration creeping to a boiling point.

Rio was giggling, her face turning into Agatha's shoulder to find momentary relief from the cold that was nipping at her cheeks the longer they could not get into the house.

"Did you hit the nine?" Rio questioned, words rocky as she tried to stop her giggles long so that she could get through the question.

"Yes!" Agatha griped back, leaning forward slightly to try and get a better view of the keypad. Rio swayed with her, still clinging to her side in fear that if she let go, her feet would betray her and she would tip over. "Seven. Four. Two. Nine." Agatha punctuated each spoken number with a press and finally, the numbers flashed green and the lock spun.

The moment the door swung open, Rio realized they had to move. Shecouldmove. It was just that in the time since they had left the bar, that final drink had settled and there was a delightful tilt to the world that she could not quite escape. It was alright, she had Agatha to prop her up. Well, until they had to move.

"One foot in front of the other, babe," Agatha tried to coach, successfully shuffling them inside so she could kick the door shut a little harder than she probably meant to as she let Rio go. The slamming sound it made caused Rio to squeal, jumping in a way that her lack of purchase on the ground caused her to sway. Like a whip, Agatha's hands were up and catching her by the shoulders to keep her steady.

"Baby, you gotta stay on your feet for us to get upstairs," Agatha tried to explain, though her own giggles were beginning to bubble in tune with Rio's. "Come on, coat off."

"Shouldn't you buy me dinner first?" Rio quipped back, shifting her arms to accommodate Agatha's removal of her coat. The moment it was dropped to the floor, Agatha shed her own and stepped forward. Rio didn't move, other than to tip back slightly as Agatha walked into her, those strong but tender hands finding station on her hips.

"I did," Agatha reminded her with a lopsided grin. "Like... four hours ago. It was... Um... It was noodles!" Her brows hiked and those blue eyes were wide as she was hit with the recollection.

"Oh." Rio blinked, as if it hit her too. "Shit, you're right. You did! Well..." She threw her arms up in her pause, the wide sleeves of her jumper sliding down them as she did so. "You have permission to strip away, then!"

Little Dreams

Turn the glass into stars
And your face is the moon
And the night turns to you
'Cause my mind is on you
