There were few things in life that Rio did not understand, or at the very least did not try to understand. In those ticking seconds as she stared at Agatha, who was still holding her phone out even though Rio was no longer looking at it, Rio simplycouldn'tunderstand.

In the grand scheme of things, the furthest encounter Rio had managed up to that point with Agatha's deeply rooted celebrity status were the few instances they had been photographed by the paparazzi and those few occurrences had not been enough to deter her. That, Rio told herself, she could handle. That, she swore, would be fine.

It had not come to settle, even in that bar with Agatha in the washroom and those two women gushing about and dishing a bit of tea on her, that this was a far bigger picture, one that Rio did not have the scope to identify it appropriately. Rio did not understand that for the most part, with Agatha's hiatus, they had been living in the smallest bubble, hidden from the pressures and demands of Agatha's career. It had been easy to do when Agatha decided that her priorities were a little different and something she'd spent her entire life doing could now wait a little longer when more important things became prevalent.

Right then, that look in Agatha's eyes only muddled Rio's comprehension further.

Slowly, Rio raised a hand to take a gentle hold on Agatha's forearm, lowering the phone, breaking the tension out of her arm as she did so, lowering it into Agatha's lap.

"So..." Rio began, her gaze slowly trailing over Agatha's expression, looking for anything that might give her a direction or some kind of clue to work with. She was coming up empty handed. "What, exactly, doesthatmean?"

It wasn't a pointed or harsh question, but itwasa request for knowledge, to know why Agatha looked so spooked and upset. Rio knew that there were far too many reasons to keep count of when it came to why Agatha had been so insistent on an exclusive and private ceremony, but Rio had made another grave miscalculation in not asking to know what they were.

It wasn't necessarily blind trust, but Rio had simply come to understand Agatha enough that if there was something Rio needed to know, Agatha would find the right time to tell her. Maybe it could have been considered naive, maybe there would come a point when Rio had to realize that just as she had her past and the things she'd chosen to do, Agatha has as much in equal measure.

Right then, it was Agatha's present that had her cheeks flushed a dark crimson and those crackles of electricity flashing in her eyes.

"It means that Dave has sent me eight emails since we've been here. He has left me four voicemails that I dare not listen to," Agatha informed her, but there was a tone there, the slightest pitch, that was unfamiliar to Rio. It was an edge, a panicked run over the whetstone, sharpening.

This was close to what Rio had heard those first few times she'd heard Agatha speak to Dave on the phone.

This was Business Agatha.

And so all of a sudden, I drop off the face of the earth for the majority of eight months and then turn up married and no one knew?"

The more Agatha explained, the heavier Rio's stomach felt. It wasn't that she didn't know about Agatha's past exploits since her divorce, it was that to Rio, they hadn't mattered. In her mind, that should have meant that it didn't matter to anyone else. She was simply observing, like she had leapt off the top of the Empire State Building, as the very heavy reality she had been ignorant to was approaching the quicker she fell.

Agatha seemed to be able to recognize the free falling mental state that Rio was in, watching as she careened into a reality that maybe she was not ready before. Agatha's grip flexed over Rio's hand in her own, a comforting show of silent support, a metaphorical show that Agatha was going to catch her before she made contact. Her gaze was strong, unwavering as she was fixed on Rio, trying to deduce the best way to say what she wanted to say.

"I can email Dave back right now and have him shoot off three 'fuck you' emails and we can let it be that..." she trailed, her gaze dropping down to their hands together before it swept back up to Rio's soft and confounded expression. "Or... You and I can sit down and go through them and we can make a decision on which one we want to interview with."

The disarray she had been feeling to that point seemed to sink deeper, seat itself even lower in her chest. None of this made sense, but what Agatha had just said made the least sense of all.

"We?" Rio asked, her lips curling down as her brow pinched tighly. "Agatha, no..."

"Yes, Rio," Agatha asserted, not giving Rio room to say another word. "There is no interview about our marriage if we don't do it together." There was a rigidity, a firmness that impacted behind every word that Agatha fired off. She meant it, through and through.

"But... Why?" Rio questioned back, biting her lip softly as she felt Agatha squeeze her hand again.

Maybe she was being foolish, maybe she was being childish. What she knew right then was that this was Agatha's territory and if Rio tried to insert herself within it? It wouldn't work; she knew nothing about what it took to present and interview. She wasn't camera trained, had never been given a talking point in her entire life because she had never needed it.

Agatha released one hand and lifted it, reaching up so that she could cup Rio's cheek in the palm of it. "Because, Rio... You are an entire person outside of your relationship with me. Agatha paused, nose scrunching a bit as she pressed her lips together, rubbing for a moment before she continued. "It's like I told you that night in the Freehand. Anything they did in life, anywhere they went, Rio always got a say as far as Agatha was concerned. Rio knew it was because that was what partnership was to Agatha, true partnership. It was something she had never really allowed herself the privilege of having and as such, she wanted to do it right. That meant being willing to embrace that while they were a couple, they were still two very individual people.

It wasn't that she looked worried, or nervous. It wasn't even that she looked upset.

She had come so far and grown so much to not keep going and not keep growing. There were years ahead of her where there was more to learn and live through, but right then it simply involved the idea that she was going to need to do things that made her uncomfortable because it would make her wife's life easier. That was what love was, at its essence. It was doing what it took to support and care for someone despite any and all of life's challenges that were thrown in a long the way.

"Well, Vogue it is, then. I think," came Rio's soft announcement. She leaned in again, this time to bump her shoulder against Agatha's as she set to pulling up her Gmail. Agatha's expression puckered and her tongue rolled out, hanging in her mock gag. "Rio, that orange juice iswarm.That's fucking gross."

"Agatha," Rio admonished, tutting her tongue at her in disapproval. "Sounds to me like you're just a wimp."

"Uhuh, no no," Agatha countered as she finished up the email and pressed send. "You are not going to goad me into drinking warm orange juice. That's not happening. I already feel sick."

Rio craned her neck, placing a peck to the side of Agatha's head. "Chicken," she teased just before she removed the contact and turned to reach over to her nightstand, pulling the glass to her so that she could toss back the few gulps left inside. As her went down and the aftertaste of the warmed and pulpy orange juice settled in every crevice of her mouth, the already agitated state of Rio's stomach started to revolt even more.

As her own mouth opened and her tongue fell out just slightly, her gag wasn't feigned. That warm liquid had dropped right to the bottom of her stomach like a boulder, leaving it unsettled and angry.

"Okay..." Rio forced, managing to swallow down that feeling one more time. "Maybe you were right. Warm orange juice is not the best."

"One day you'll learn I know what I'm talking about," Agatha pointed out, a playfully cocky air to her words. She leaned back into the pillows, scooting down the slightest bit so that she was in prime position for Rio to fit herself under the crook of her arm, in her spot.

With ease, Rio folded right into place as her head landed in its home on Agatha's chest. Agatha arm hooked around her shoulder, firm grip landing around the side of Rio's bicep, exposed from the sleep tank top she had put on, knowing that the likelihood of them leaving that day was slim to none.

"Always my love,"Rio answered automatically.

"What are you thinking about all of this?"

Despite how absolutely tanked her body felt as a result of their night of debauchery and how much she was looking forward to her nap, such a question seemed to wake her right up. Her eyes opened and focused on a spot on the far side of the room, right on a framed portrait of a puffin.

What was Rio thinking about all of it?

The only way she knew to answer was to be honest.

"I... I don't really know right now,"she admitted, breathing a soft sigh as she turned her face to nuzzle into Agatha's chest a little, as if she might find a better answer there. When she didn't, she tried her best to continue anyway."And maybe I won't until we get home, back to actual life. But... it all just is starting to make more sense. And... I have known who you are for some time now, and I knew the life you lived before I even put myself on that plane."

Rio paused, her hand raising to pinch a piece of Agatha's shirt between her thumb and forefinger, rubbing the cotton between it nervously. She closed her eyes, inhaling slowly before she released it, finally able to find her words again.

"I guess it's just finally come time that I need to start understanding what what all actually means. I... I understood the TMZ pictures and everything, but... I guess I was just foolishly naive to not let myself recognize that it could, and likely would, get bigger than that."As Rio stopped speaking, she tucked her bottom lip between her teeth, chewing softly out of nothing more than sheer nerves.

Before Agatha could bring herself to answer, Rio could almost swear she felt Agatha shrink beneath her. It was this fleeting thought, just a brief moment where she considered for a moment that Agatha was buckling at something life had thrown at her. Then, it was gone and Agatha's heart was beating just a little harder in her chest, an indication that what Rio had felt was not at all simply a figment of her imagination.

"I know that... I did not do the best job at bracing you for this, and I truly am sorry for that. I just... I guess I thought we were going to have more time."

Agatha's sincerity was bleeding out of her, not just in the sound of her voice, but in the way her palm fastened to Rio's arm again, giving it a light squeeze as if the action might insist to Rio that she meant what she had said.

"My love, it really is okay,"Rio assured her in a murmur."I'm going to figure it out. I just... might need some time. But I'll get there.Wewill get there."

"You're right, we will. But for now, we rest, hm?"Agatha offered back, leaning enough to grace the crown of Rio's head with the lightest contact of her lips.

"Mmhmm,"she sounded in return, letting her eyes fall closed again. Those familiar sounds of Agatha's breathing and her heartbeat culminated in a symphony, one that was sure to put Rio out with relative ease.

If that had not been enough, the moment she shifted so that Agatha's hand was able to fall comfortably to her back and those light touches started, she was a complete goner.

Not entirely sure how long she had been asleep, Rio stirred and even before she opened her eyes, she sensed that the sun was no longer pouring in through the windows.

As her eyes fluttered open to behold the bedroom, she realized that she was right: it was very dark outside. What she noticed in the very next second was that the bed was devoid of any other occupant. Rio's forehead creased with her confusion and disappointment, her eyes lifting to the en suite, though the door was open and it was dark inside.

"Agatha?" Rio called, but she was met with little more than silence.

With a gentle push, Rio was upright. Immediately, she realized that she felt considerably better than she had before she had fallen asleep again, but she didn't quite feel tip-top. That was nothing more than a thought in the back of her mind as she tried to consider where Agatha might be.

It was possible she was in the kitchen, but it didn't smell like anything was being cooked. She could have simply been watching television downstairs as to not wake Rio from her nap, but the house felt too quiet for that to be true. After another moment of consideration, Rio slid out of bed and pulled a pair of flannel pajama bottoms over the shorts she had one. No other move was made to cover her bare arms and she departed the room, heading downstairs.

It was still too quiet, and it was dark. There weren't any lights on inside in the kitchen or living area.

There was one light on, though.

It was the one that illuminated the back patio, the one they had turned on when they'd gotten into the hot tub.

Why was the back patio light on?

And where the hell was Agatha?

Despite finding no humor in waking up with no idea where idea her wife was, the moment Rio placed herself in front of the sliding glass door and looked to the left, every bit of annoyance and irritation she might have had evaporated just like that.

It had snowed. It had actually snowed quite a bit since the night before.

Outside, in her big black coat and her grey hat with the white pom on the top, Agatha was hoisting the smallest of three sizeable snowballs on top of the other two. It settled, but she still held her gloved hands out on either side of it, as if to catch it if the weight wasn't distributed correctly.

Agatha wasbuilding a snowman?

They did not have coal, but it seemed to havd been of little consequence. That was even more apparent as Agatha took a step back and reached down, extracting the carrot she had planted there in the snow, a holster until she was ready to draw it. She seemed to survey her creation before she carefully pressed the carrot into the middle of head. Once secure, she used a padded thumb to press indents in for eyes to make due for their lack of suitable ocular replacements.

Rio watched her drag that thumb in a curve below the carrot, gracing her snowman with a large smile. When she was satisfied, Agatha took a step back and planted her hands on her hips, giving a confident and proud nod. Even though Rio could not see her face, she knew Agatha was wearing a shit-eating grin.

Her eyes never left Agatha as she reached for the door handle and pulled it open, placing herself in the doorway enough that she could lean outside to project her voice.

"What are you doing, my love?" Rio called warmly, the adoration deep in her words.

Startled, Agatha whipped around, looking like a child who had been caught with their hand inside of a cookie jar. Her head sank into her shoulders and her wide grin grew sheepish. She stepped back and angled her arms as if to display her work with pride.

"I made you a snowman!" she declared, beaming.

"Does he have a name?" Rio inquired loudly, though she wasn't quite shouting over the sound of the wind.

"No... I suppose he doesn't. What do you want to name him?"

Rio took this into heavy consideration for a brief moment, her face cinching in her focus as she racked her brain for something clever, something she knew would make Agatha laugh. Alas, she found it.

"Meltin' John!" she announced, her own pride winning out at how witty she was.

Agatha's face nearly cracked with her grin as her arms flew up to her middle, doubling over with her instant giggles.

"Meltin' John?!" she cried back through her howls of laughter.

"Yes. Now leave him out to freeze and come inside and let me make you soup!" Rio tried to bargain, though she knew she didn't have to try hard.

Agatha straightened back up but her raucous joy had not desisted. Instead, she raised a gloved hand to wipe a tear off of her cheek before the wind could get to it. "Meltin'... John... Jesus Christ," she wheezed, fighting to calm herself down.

"Come inside! It's cold!"

Agatha's grin remained steadfast, fixed to her face as though it were permanent.

"Are you gonna warm me up?" It was suggestive, yes, but there was something a little closer to softness in her question.

"Always, my love."

Tell Me Your Secrets

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

In the naked rush
Like an open blade
I would lay you down
If for a moment, just stay
*****

It had not taken long for things to go back to their regularly scheduled honeymoon programming, normal as ever...

Almost.

Galivanting around the city, seeing the sights, watching the Northern Lights, they had been immaculate experiences from top to bottom. Spending evenings at nice dinners, mornings cooking breakfast together, those moments had been everything in life Rio had needed them to be. Even nights in the hot tub or making out on the couch until they stumbled their way to bed were solidified as treasured memories, ones Rio could hold onto forever.

Then, there were other happenings, though they were immeasurably minute ones in the grand scheme of things. Still, they were ones that Rio couldn't help but get caught up on, mind spinning circles over them when she knew it truly was needless.

It was how at dinner one night, Agatha had this strange look in her eyes right before she accidentally knocked her wine glass off of the table, causing it to shatter on the floor.

Even more off-brand had been her reaction. She looked genuinely upset as she stared down at what she had done. It had lasted only a few seconds, but something about it had sounded like a whistle in Rio's head, a call for her attention. Before she could address it, it was gone and Agatha was righted where she sat, her hands back on the table and that calm, warm smile curving her lips like nothing had happened at all.

A member of staff had arrived to clean up the glass and while Agatha had apologized, no other trace of the incident seemed to remain with her. That was good; it had been an accident, but that look on her face was still clear as day like a photo in Rio's mind.

In another instance, Rio had been upstairs changing her clothes for their day out when she heard Agatha deliver a loudFUCK!from her place in the living room. When Rio had rushed to finish dressing herself and came bounding down the stairs to find the cause of the commotion, she saw Agatha calmly picking a magazine up off of the floor. She reached up to smooth her hair as she tossed it on the coffee table, clearly dissatisfied with whatever was inside it.

"My love, are you alright?" Rio had asked, cautious but still concerned as she approached the back of the couch, peering across it to where Agatha stood at the edge of the coffee table.

"Yes, just read something I vehemently disagree with, but it's nothing," Agatha returned, and while shesoundedconvincing, there was something more there. It was nervousness. It wasn't in her tone, but it was in her eyes and Rio could see it.

She almost asked. She was so close to asking Agatha what was on her mind, but before she could, Agatha was moving and insisting they head out and get their day started.

In all reality, they were the tiniest things. In Rio's reality, they were enough to know that something was going on inside of her wife's head that she was not willing or ready to talk about. Rio knew that it was perfectly normal to have thoughts and feelings like that, and to need time to figure out how to break them down. She knew what it was like to be caught up in the tides of too many things to consider and think about, but seeing it on Agatha struck her in an unfamiliar way.

What it came down to was that it hadn't started happening until after they had been informed of the leak. Everything before that had been typical for them, but even the smallest blips since had been noticeable. Maybe Rio had always been perceptive, but her perception when it came to Agatha seemed to be unparalleled.

If Agatha was not ready to discuss it, then Rio would wait until she was. It had to be that simple.

When Rio roused that morning, the first thing she had noticed was just how tightly Agatha was holding onto her, wrapped around her from behind. It was so tight that she assumed Agatha was awake and aware of what she was doing. When she snored into Rio's hair, Rio realized she was still asleep and that Agatha's subconscious was the one holding on for dear life.

Something about it coupled with the fact that it was their last full day in Iceland sent an ache through Rio's chest. It wasn't that she was upset about leaving, it was just that it had been so,sonice to be separate from the world again. It was something Rio had been so used to doing for the majority of her life, but getting to do it with Agatha this time had been a new kind of peace Rio had never really known before.

But it, like all things, had to come to an end.

Due to prioritizing other things, such as hiking and dinner dates and drinks withSds and Elfa, they had pushed off smaller tasks that were not as significant and could be done should they make a return, which was already pinned to the 'things to do in the future' board.

One thing Agatha had been persistent about was going ice skating. She had mentioned it at least once a day, sometimes twice, and while Rio truly had tried to put up a decent argument as to why it was a terrible idea, she had known she was going to cave far before she actually did.

So, with the dawn of their last day seeping in through the haphazardly closed curtains, a day of plans to finally go ice skating lay ahead of them.

Waking up like that, clutched in Agatha's grasp, it made Rio not want to move an inch, let alone go out in public and make a complete fool of herself. Would it be embarrassing? Likely. Would she make Agatha's entire day by conceding and at least making some kind of effort? Also likely. It did feel like an appropriate thing to do with their time drawing to a close, something silly and fun, something they could lose themselves in for a few hours before the call of the real world sounded in their ears again.

Not wanting to break the sense of serenity, Rio had simply laid there like that in Agatha's hold for a little while longer, at least until Agatha stirred to consciousness.

"Mmm, is it morning?"Agatha grumbled right before she nuzzled her face into the back of Rio's neck, exhaling a breathy and exhausted sigh.

"It is. Probably around ten,"Rio answered, bringing a hand to rest on Agatha's forearm which had loosened its hold in her awakened state.

Agatha groaned behind her and shifted so that she could tuck her chin over Rio's shoulder, laying her head atop Rio's in an attempt to get as close as she could. Rio was immediately met with the smell of her shampoo, her hair landing in a way that tickled Rio's cheek. In the adjustment, Agatha had shifted so that her arm was hooked diagonally over Rio's torso, hand on her shoulder that was pressed to the mattress.

"Let's just stay in bed,"Rio suggested, though she was certain Agatha couldhearthe smirk she was wearing without having to bear witness to it herself.

"You are not getting out of it, not a chance,"Agatha murmured, tucking her head enough that her nose brushed against Rio's cheek."I have to get at least one picture of you on ice skates for the sake of our children. If I tell them I had the chance and didn't take it, they'll never let me live it down."

Rio exhaled in a sound that somehow melted in the middle between being a grunt and a whine, knowing that she would never hear the end of it herself if she wound up on her ass in the middle of a crowd of people who had likely been able to execute such a skill since they were toddlers.

"You know I'm going to look like a dumbass, right?"Rio whispered back, her fingers raking likely over Agatha's arm.

"No, you're going to look cute all bundled up trying to move around with baby deer legs while you figure it out. Which you will do. Because you can do anything,"Agatha informed her. The deepness with which her voice sounded caused the tiniest vibrations against Rio's skull with the way they were laying, as if Agatha's honest were shaking its way through Rio's very bones.

"Unshakable faith in me, have you?"Rio posed, the softest and sweetest giggle rattling her for just a moment.

"Always my love."Agatha turned her head and pressed a kiss to Rio's temple, giving her the gentlest hug from behind."Now let's get showered and ready. We can have a quick breakfast and head out, hm?"

Instead of providing an immediate response, Rio rolled in place so that as she settled, their skin touched almost everywhere. Breasts brushed and molded to press flatter, though Rio could feel very acutely where her nipples stiffened against Agatha's form in automatic response.

Their eyes met across the couple of inches of pillow between their heads and while Rio's lips twitched upward in some trace of a smile, there were the smallest hints of sadness and disappointment that could be found there.

Rio had made her own choices, ones that weren't healthy. She had chosen to close herself off because she could, because no one was watching her enough to care.

Agatha, on the other hand, had never not been watched. People were always looking at her, always waiting for her to make her next move. Even before her fame, she had been under the scrutiny of her mother's angry and contemptuous gaze. All Agatha had done was jump from one spotlight to another, even if it hadn't actually been her intention in regard to the ramifications that came with those decisions.

She had felt so trapped in the choices she'd been convinced shehadto make that she'd furthered the problem by making more choices that fell into a very grey moral area. She had sought out relief in desperation and instead, carried shame over it nearly twenty years later. She shut the world out, only allowing for physical connection, and she lived up to her moniker of being a Witch because that was how she had needed the world to see her.

Agatha would always be the Wild Witch in the public eye, and that was something Rio actually had a fondness for, but it was because she knew who Agathareallywas beneath the ambition, the drive, and the trauma.

As the tears began to roll down her cheeks, Rio realized perhaps the most important fact in all of this pain and ache and shame.

Agatha told her, even with her fears, because she needed Rio to finally know her fully and wholly.

Agatha had told her without telling her:

With this last piece of me, I am completely yours.

and that agatha's past still had a little bit of uncovering that needed to be done

was going to carry on the way it is, i knew i had some time find the right way
to bring it to light.

Tell Me It Gets Easier

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Face up, untouched, gazing at the ceiling
Game's up, never bring you down
Face up, our love's, craving for some feeling
Game's up, we're nowhere to be found
*****

By the time Agatha's alarm sounded before the sun had even considered reaching for the horizon, Rio had slept maybe three hours, at most. Even those three hours had been broken at least twice by her jolting awake, feeling like she had been falling in a dream.

Each time, she would blink, focus, and then look down at the weight on her chest to see Agatha, still sound asleep.

Every time, she would muse to herself that Agatha likely could have slept through an earthquake with the emotional exhaustion she had to be feeling at carrying something so heavy around with her for the better part of her life.

Even trying to write it off as being human and making mistakes never would have worked for her. Agathaknewthat what she had done was wrong, that it had been bad choice after bad choice. It might have been what she needed to make it through her life at the time, but that did not negate the guilt she was feeling as a result of makingthosespecific choices. It wasn't even the act itself, Rio knew, it was that Agatha had found a loophole in the one staunch belief she had and she had abused it.

What Rio could see, so plainly, was that Agatha was afraid. She had been afraid that Rio could come about that knowledge from an outside source, and she had been afraid of what that knowledge might do to Rio without any other context presented. Oh, how broken Agatha Harkness was.

She realized suddenly that she was feeling something she had felt only once before.

It was the exact amalgamation of emotions that had left her moved the night she had stopped in the doorway of the hotel room at the Freehand when she had checked out to go home with Agatha.

It had been a goodbye to a beginning. Right then, it was too similar to be anything other than the same, just thousands of miles away and considerably colder.

The Freehand was where Rio had fallen in love with Agatha Harkness.

Iceland was where Rio fell even further in love with her wife.

"My love, are you alright?" Agatha called to her from the top of the steps, leaning through the doorway to be heard clearer.

Rio's head snapped to her and she offered a small smile in the growing light of dawn. "I am," she answered, turning her head to look out one last time. "Just committing it to memory before I go."

The tired and warm smile her wife wore as she waved her hand in encouragement felt so comforting, like a tight hug that always told her where Agatha went, she would always want her to follow.

It had not taken long for them to get settled and moments after, they were in the air again, headed back to America to begin the process of sorting their lives out. "My love," Rio offered, reaching up to cup Agatha's cheek in her palm. "I will never hesitate to tell you that making bad choices does not make you a bad person. "How do you see so much good in me?" she questioned and while Rio had almost expected the question to come out broken or quiet, she had been surprised when it was resolved and strong.

With a grin that was tapered immediately, Rio placed a tender kiss to her wife's lips. It was another promise, another guarantee that no matter how things went, Rio was going to be right there to help her through it.

*****

When they had landed in LA a little after 8am, Rio had expected to find Gio waiting for them to take them home so that they could collapse in bed and sleep off the jetlag and nerves for at least an entire day.

What she hadn't expected was for their four children to be waiting in the hanger to greet them.

Agatha saw them first, through the window, as they stood by the car and immediately called Rio's attention, pointing a thin finger to indicate them. Leaning forward, the sight of them caused a grin so big to form on her face that she thought it might crack.

Their feet had not even touched American concrete by the time Estee had taken off, bolting over to where they were to throw her arms around Rio's neck, hugging her nightly.

"Oh, mija, I missed you so much," Rio greeted into her thick hair.

"I've been away longer before because of uni," Estee returned, but she wasn't done and continued when she pulled back to look at her mother. "But knowing I couldn't hop on a couple hour flight to come see you hit a little different. Glad to have you home."

Rio reached up, ruffling her daughter's hair to then pull her in so Rio could kiss her forehead.

"Did you lot have fun while we were gone?" Rio asked, though as she lifted her gaze, it fell on the sight of Agatha with Nicky in her arms, holding him tightly.

Nicky did not know what was in his immediate future, but Rio did, and as such knew what that kind of an embrace meant to Agatha.

"We did," Nicky chirped, untangling himself from his mother. Before he could offer any insight, Estee was speaking again.

"Give me that," she requested, indicating Rio's small bag that was clutched in her fingers. Rio's eyes dropped as Estee extended her hand and then they widened at what she saw there.

On the outside of her wrist, to the right of her pulse point, there was a small silhouette of a bird in flight tattooed on her skin.

Rio's free hand snapped up, hooking around Estee's forearm, those bright green eyes completely locked in on the new ink.

"No way,"Rio breathed, fixated to a point where she did not notice as everyone else shuffled over, Nicky and Agatha included. "Estrella Liliana, when did you get this?"

"We all got them," Nicky voiced.

Rio lifted her head, turning to the sight of Nicky, Tay, andHmi all holding their arms up, small birds branded into their skin in the same spot as Estee's and the largest grins on their faces.

"It was a few days after you left. We were eating dinner and talking and... Birds of a feather flock together, right? Plus, we're on planes so damn much," Estee explained, laughing softly.

Such an explanation almost took Rio out at the knees. She had always known what a personal whirlwind this had all been since that very first day, but knowing that her daughter had formed these bonds, these relationships with people she had come to love irrevocably, it touched Rio. She was seeing first-hand what it meant to Estee to finally have a family.

When Rio released her hold, Estee's focus dropped in time to see the way Rio's hand moved palm-up, revealing her own mark of forever.

"Oh! Hypocrite!" she cried, this time the one to grab hold of Rio's forearm to pay closer attention to what she saw there. "Mama, oh my god..."

Rio felt swelteringly hot beneath her daughter's scrutiny but did her best to shake the feeling and appear as nonplussed as she could.

"That's not the only one," came Agatha's insight this time. She was quick, reaching for the waist of her pants in a way that caused Nicky's hand to fly to his eyes.

"Mom!"

"Oh, stop it, Nicky," she chastised, lowering the band just enough to reveal the green paper flower that was inked there.

"You guys!" Estee gushed, but Rio was removing her hold so that she could reveal her own on the opposite hip as Agatha's, hers that soft purple color. Estee looked back to her and dropped her attention, her grin so wide and toothy Rio knew it had to hurt. "I cannot believe you heathens!"

"Okay, that's seriously the cutest," Tay chimed from half a foot behind Estee.

"Agatha has another one, too," Rio informed them, glancing to her wife with a bright curl of her lips.

Agatha reached up at the same time she leaned forward a little, pulling her ponytail to the opposite side so that she could bend her ear forward to reveal the terribly drawn boat behind it.

"It's the one she drew when she showed up at the office and left her number," Agatha informed those who might not have been aware of what such a mark actually meant.

"So..." Nicky began, the numbers adding up in his head. "The four of us collectively got four tattoos... And jointly, you guys got four tattoos. So... We have gained eight tattoos since the wedding. What in the world?" He had already started laughing before he finished speaking, joined a moment later by everyone else.

Itwaspretty crazy.

But it was alsoso very them.

"Did any of you have to bail any of the others out of jail in our absence?" Agatha asked, eyes sweeping around to the four twenty-somethings in their presence.

"There was only the one time Estee --"Hmi started, but Estee's hand flew up immediately to silence him.

"HE'S KIDDING!" she all but shouted, causing Rio to grin. She knew Estee was lying. It was painfully obvious.

"What did you do, mija?" Rio asked, chin tucking in her interrogation.

"Okay somaybethere was a girl at the club flirting withHmi who wouldn't leave him alone while Nicky was getting drinks. AndmaybeI walked behind her and pulled her hair hard enough that she fell. We left promptly after." She told the story as though she were completely in the right, punctuating the end with an innocent shrug of her shoulders.

"Oh, there was no 'maybe' to it," Nicky shot, his grin wide and toothy. "She folded that bitch like a lawn chair. I saw it from the bar."

"Nicholas! Why are you making me sound like a cage fighter?!" she almost screeched, looking a little flustered at being sold out with such ease.

Meanwhile, everyone else had given into completely amused laugher at the two of them bickering like siblings. It was touching, really, especially for Rio who was now getting more of a view of what being an actual family was going to look like. Sure, their children were grown, but they acted like they had spent their entire lives annoying each other and driving one another insane.

"You should moonlight,"Hmi suggested through his chuckling. "I'd put my money on you."

After a few more exchanged embraces, the six of them loaded into the Lexus Gio had been smart enough to bring from Agatha's personal garage. As everyone loaded in, Nicky was left on the concrete, stomping his foot in his feigned petulance.

"Why do I have to sit up front by myself?" he whined, though he was grinning despite himself.

"Hey, what am I? Chopped liver?" Gio called, leaning back so he could see Nicky through the open back door.

"Of course not, Gio," Nicky returned, opening the front door to slide into the passenger's seat. "You're the best DJ in LA. Let's play some Nickelback."

There was a collective groan from every other occupant in the car which caused Nicky to fall prey to bright and loud laughter, thrilled with his own antics.

The ride home had been comparatively short than it felt most times, due mostly to the vibrant and bright chatter from the occupants. There was so much love in that car, so much care and dedications between every single one of them. Rio and Agatha were not shy about how much they had missed the lot of them, but the kids seemed eager to assure them that they had been just as missed and how deeply their absences were felt.

Estee and Tay had spilled about the couple of times they'd hung out with a few of the Landon women -- Cole, Dalia, and Thea -- on the beach or grabbing dinner, clearly thrilled with making new friends stateside. Nicky and Hemi talked about their brief trip to Tijuana and all of the fresh fruit they'd brought back with them.

Rio could have sat there all day long, just listening to their children talk about their lives. She was taking every word in, devouring the utter joy she was receiving from listening to their laughter and them tattle on each other about the mischief they had been up to over the past couple of weeks.

They had already become a family before the wedding, but on that car ride home, Rio really, truly felt it. She could feel the adoration, the affection that was filling the enclosed space around them and wove into each and every one of them. They were truly the Harkness-Vidals in all of their glory, even before it was official for Tay andHmi.

The kids had been insistent in carrying in their things and the two women had followed them upstairs as they stowed the suitcases and bags just inside the bedroom door and straightened back up to offer embraces.

"I'm takingHmi to the airport in about an hour. He's got training this week," Nicky informed them as he parted from the embrace he had given his mother.

"Aww," Rio whined softly in protest as she pulledHmi into her arms, giving him a tight hug. "Sad that you can't stay longer, but we really appreciate that you stayed to greet us."

"Wouldn't have missed it," he assured her, giving her shoulder a light squeeze. "I should be back in a couple of weeks, if only for the weekend."

"We will always be happy to have you," Agatha informed him, holding her arms open to hug him, too.

"We're gonna lay down too," Estee informed them, sliding up to Rio's side so that she could wrap her arms around her mother's middle, locking in tightly. "But if you want to go to In-N-Out later, come find us. We will be happy to tag along."

"You got it, mija," Rio agreed easily, kissing the top of her head.

"Me too!" Nicky chimed.

"You never turn down a Flying Dutchman," Agatha chided, digging a finger into his ribs at the same time she kissed the side of his head. A mere second later, she threw her hands up, waving them about dramatically. "Alright! Children! Move about your lives! Your mothers have a nap to take, one of dire importance!"

Every other person in the room, Rio included, dissolved into laughter, though the kids had already started to shuffle toward the doorway.

"We love you," Agatha called after them, Rio agreeing in the next breath.

"And be safe,Hmi!" Rio added, her voice loud enough to carry down the hallway.

"I will, Mama Rio! Enjoy your nap!"

Rio was grinning from ear to ear, even as she turned directly into Agatha's embrace, arms locked tightly around her middle as Rio's head dropped to her shoulder.

"We are home,"Agatha murmured at her, giving her a firm squeeze.

"We are. And we are exhausted. Maybe not the best idea to stay up so late,"Rio teased in a whisper, giggling quietly as she tipped her head back to brush her lips against the side of Agatha's neck.

"Maybe not. But... I don't have anything scheduled for two more days. So, technically, we could sleep for the next two days and be fine."

Rio lifted her head, looking directly into those warm, comforting blue pools of endless hope as her lips curled up at the corners."Maybe just a couple of hours at first. And then we can take the kids and I can get my Crazy-Style fries."

"Animal style,"Agatha corrected, but the moment she saw the look in Rio's eyes, she slumped slightly."You do that on purpose, don't you?"

Rio ducked her head forward, stealing a chaste kiss, first from Agatha's lips and then one on the tip of her nose.

"Of course I do. You think it's adorable, and don't saw it's not true because I know it is."Rio took one last kiss before she untangled herself from the way she'd been wrapped around her wife and stripped her t-shirt and hoodie off. They were unceremoniously discarded and she shed her leggings as well, leaving her in only her bra and little boy short underwear as she crawled into bed.

Agatha nearly mimicked her actions step for step, leaving them to find one another in the center of that big, comfortable, homey bed they had left empty in their absence. It took little time, curled up behind Agatha with her arms around her middle and face nuzzled into Agatha's still-wild ponytail, for Rio to drift off to sleep.

She was not entirely sure how long they had slept, but judging by the amount of light pouring in the windows, Rio felt she could safely assume that it was some time in the middle of the afternoon. Surprisingly, she realized that Agatha was still in her arms, still sleeping. Normally, Agatha was the first one to rouse in most circumstances, but Rio realized that it could have been a couple of things.

It was possible she truly was just exhausted from the emotional comedown of their conversation, but it was also possible that her subconscious was trying to prolong the conversation she knew she needed to have with their son.

Rio did not disturb her and otherwise stayed where she was, even when she heard Nicky come in the front door and then exited out the back a few minutes later, likely to tuck into the poolhouse to unwind and textHmi until his flight took off. Rio wanted him to have that, to be able to find those last few moments of peace before Agatha necessarily upended his life.

Though her eyes were shut and her breathing stayed relatively even, Rio did not fall back asleep in the forty or so minutes it took for Agatha to wake up. Even once she did, they shifted around enough that Rio and rolled to her back and Agatha had flipped over, curling into her side.

"Did you nap well, my love?"Rio murmured, lips pressing and staying to the crown of Agatha's head.

"Like a rock,"Agatha informed her in a light groan, snuggling a little closer.

Rio's fingers had started gentle work on Agatha's back, tracing light lines just below the band of her bra, dragging softly over her skin. They were quiet for the next passing moments, simply reveling in what it felt like to be back in their places, folded into one another in a way they would always be.

Finally, Agatha started to move around, pulling herself into a sitting position. She rubbed her eyes and heaved a soft sigh.

"Do you think it would be a good idea to get dinner first?" Rio questioned, her voice running more along the timid side, caution so very apparent.

"Probably not. I.. Should see if he's back home and get it out of the way," she replied, her tone mild but just above a whisper.

"He is. He came home a little while ago. He's in the pool house."

Agatha sighed again, this one a little heavier.

"I can do this... right?" Agatha asked aloud and while Rio knew that it might have been rhetorical, she felt compelled to answer anyway.

"You absolutely can do this, my love," she affirmed, reaching up to gently rub Agatha's lower back in support.

"I suppose I should, then," she concluded. Rio had thought that she was going to get up to dress herself but instead, Agatha leaned back, dropping to hold herself up on her elbow. She dropped her head, kissing Rio full-on in a way that did not show force but certainly showed a need for strength and resolve. Rio could give her that.

"I love you. It's going to be alright,"Rio promised her when she backed away, those blue eyes opening to reveal how much fear was held within them.

"And if it's not, even for a little bit, we can have Gio go get us our cheeseburgers and eat them in bed while we turn on some film we don't pay attention to while you cope with your feelings. No matter how it goes, you just have to come back to me and we will figure it out together."

That look on Agatha's face was so worried, but also so soft in its understanding that Rio meant every single word she had said.

"I love you so much,"Agatha whispered, stealing one more kiss before she got to her feet and pulled on a pair of shorts and a t-shirt so that she could venture forth to a battle she might never be prepared for.

Agatha got to the doorway but stopped directly in it, hand on the frame as she turned back to look at Rio.

"I can do it,"she voiced, and while she said it as a statement, Rio felt the need to supply an answer.

"You can do it, my love. And you will."

Chapter End Notes

I said I was going to take a break.
I have been endlessly spamming the
Tyler the Creator "That was a fucking lie" gif

Give Me Perspective That Rattles My Bones

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Mind in a prison, my heart in a cage
 Sins of the mother and son where they lay
 *****

Twenty minutes passed, then thirty.

Rio was trying to keep herself busy by scrolling through the archive of photos that head4harkness.tumblr.com had curated that provided a visual timeline of most of Agatha's career. She had yet to inform Agatha that she had uncovered the blog after the first time they'd gone out for drinks with the Iceland girls and was instead taking the time to save almost every single picture found there to her phone.

The truth was, it was a preview of what the world had witnessed throughout the years when it came to her wife. There were photos from premieres, video clips of interviews, behind-the-scenes photos, and even a slim few from when she was in college. It was a complete catalog dedicated to the woman she loved so dearly and it instilled a variety of emotions within Rio.

Whilst the blog title could have been deemed crass, the content posted was all tasteful and respectful. It was clear that whoever ran the blog was simply dedicated and had an appreciation for Agatha's abilities and her display of them throughout the decades.

Some of the photos, ones where Agatha seemed no older than mid-twenties, there was a vast difference in the brightness of her smile and eyes from the photos less than half a decade later. That was when things had changed for her, when she had made the first on a very long list of bad choices and her life's course had been altered beyond her control.

Agatha still looked happy in those photos, but not as happy as she had before an obligatory marriage and a child she had never planned for came into the picture.

Rio knew it would do her no good to try and analyze every single photo to a point where she was making herself crazy, but she couldn't help but note the small differences, the little changes that appeared, gently scribed into those beautiful features.

Maybe no one else would have been able to pick out the way the crow's feet at the corners of Agatha's eyes formed and deepened. It could have gone unnoticed the way those little eleven lines between her brows had rutted so much that they were still there even when she was calm and expression smoothed. No one else would have noticed the additional navy flecks that had formed in her irises the older Agatha got, not the way Rio did.

Rio knew, as she scrolled through those pictures, that there were miles and miles of her wife still left for her to explore and understand. She also knew that the only way to get that information was to ask questions, though she was impossibly understanding of the fact that it would be something better suited for another day.

Her green eyes flickered up to the corner of her phone screen, realizing Agatha had been gone almost an hour. As if on cue, Rio heard a soft knocking down the hall, too far to be their room. The door opened -- presumably Estee's -- and then closed again.

Rio tried to funnel her attention back onto the phone in her hand, but something was happening and she was trying to understand what without inserting herself directly into the situation. It took only a minute or two until a piece fell into place.

The door down the hall opened and shut again, but this time a blonde head of hair poked through the doorway and Tay, while smiling, was not completely selling that it was genuine. "I'm going to Van's for some snacks. Is there anything you or Agatha would want me to grab?"

Rio felt like she was working on a slide puzzle in her mind, trying to rearrange the jumbled image before her so that it made any sort of sense. She knew that Tay had asked her a very clear question, but it had a lot of implications. Tay was not the type to make random evening grocery runs alone, and with the previous request for entrance to their bedroom, Rio knew there was more to it.

Nicky had gone to Estee.

Nicky had needed to talk to Estee, and Tay was running a mindless errand to give them some time.

Where was Agatha?

"Erm," Rio finally managed, finding her focus again as she watched Tay in the doorway. "Could you grab us a bottle of whiskey and the biggest bag of mini Snickers you can find?"

It was minimal, but alcohol and chocolate might not be the worst idea when it came to the night that possibly lay ahead of them.

"Of course, mama. If you think of anything else, just text me." Her voice was low, soft, but with the way she was looking at Rio like that, Rio knew that this was fragile. This was something that was going to have to be handled with care on all ends.

"Te amo, mija," Rio voiced, a tight smile tugging on her lips.

"I love you, too. I'll be back in a little bit." Tay offered a light wave and departed, leaving Rio to finish trying to slide the pieces into place.

The question still remained.

Where was Agatha if Nicky was in Estee's room?

Rio locked her phone and set it on her nightstand as she swung her legs over the edge of the bed, pushing herself up so she could pace to the window that overlooked the back scape of their home. The light in the pool house was still on.

There did not appear to be any movement inside, nor could Rio see through the window to know for certain that Agatha was inside, but something in her gut told her that was where she would find her.

To give her a few more moments, Rio relocated to the kitchen and started a pot of coffee. Despite committing to the idea of waiting until it was done brewing and she made them each a cup, she could not help but to glance outside every so often to see if Agatha was going to choose to come out on her own.

By the time the coffee was done and both cups were made, Agatha remained inside the pool house.

Rio hooked her fingers through the handles of the mugs and made her way outside, utilizing her elbows to get doors open and shut. By the time the one to the pool house clicked behind her, she was not sure what she was walking into, but what she saw nearly shattered her.

On the far end of the sectional inside, Agatha was bent over her knees, face buried in her hands. Rio didn't need to see the way her body was trembling to immediately know she was crying. It was a sight that had been more and more frequent as of late and while Rio understood it as milestones of personal growth for her wife, it didn't actually soften to blow of bearing witness to it happening.

Quietly, Rio paced over and placed both mugs of coffee on the glass table in front of the couch before sitting directly next to Agatha, only because it was not practical with how Agatha was positioned to drop all of her weight onto her like a heavy blanket that could soothe her worries. Instead, Rio shifted around enough that she could wrap her arm firmly around Agatha's shoulder, pulling her into her chest.

Thankfully, Agatha dropped her hands and leaned into Rio's pull, her wet cheek landing on the soft fabric of her shirt. Rio's free touch lifted and found Agatha's hair, gingerly running her fingers through it to try and soothe her in whatever way she could without knowing exactly what it was that had happened and what had been said.

"It's alright, my love,"Rio whispered and while Agatha was not making a sound, the way she was still shaking gave away the fact that she was still crying.

Agatha had been tryingsohard to right things with Nicky, and they had come miles from the night Agatha had taken Rio home for the first time to be startled by his presence. He had said some impossibly harsh things that night, things that had really cut Agatha and as such, Rio was left wondering if this had been nothing more than a repeat.

The one thing that seemed to guide her away from such an assumption was that Nicky had not stormed in, he had not slammed doors, and he had been impeccably calm when he had tapped on Estee's door, at least in the way that he hadn't been trying to beat it down to get her attention. Even Tay's reaction seemed to lend to the fact that the primary emotion being felt between Agatha and Nicky was not anger but instead regret mixed with pain.

Agatha did not speak or otherwise make any sound that was not a sniffle as she let herself be held by the woman who loved her most in the world. Rio knew what a responsibility that was and she would never take it lightly. The silence wore on around them for minutes, only interrupted by the sound of the pump in the back room kicking on and off.

It might have felt like an eternity later, but Agatha finally began to shift, to pull herself away from Rio's chest so that they could meet eye-to-eye. Rio knew it was a way for Agatha to find her resolve, to find some crumb of strength so that she could recount something that had very obviously injured her. Everything between her and Nicky had always been so precarious, but she'd had a lot of very big and very weighted things to tell him and depending on how receptive he had been, it could very well fracture their relationship irreparably.

To offer her some semblance of courage, Rio lifted the hand that had been running through Agatha's hair before she had moved and cupped her cheek, thumb gracing so carefully over her wet cheek.

"Whenever you're ready, I'm right here,"Rio whispered, leaning in to take the briefest kiss that tasted of nothing but salt.

Agatha's bottom lip pulled in, tucking over teeth that dug into it roughly. It was clear that even though she had spent all that time trying to figure out how to discuss what she had just endured, she was still at a loss.

"It's okay, Agatha. We talk about it first, then we figure it out, right?"Rio murmured at her, that thumb still pacing soft lines along Agatha's cheekbone.

Agatha gave the slightest nod of her head, so shallow in its movement that if Rio hadn't been holding onto her face and felt it, she might not have noticed it at all. Slowly, Agatha's chest rose with an even breath that she held for only a moment before she exhaled it, letting out some of her tension along with it.

"That was... so hard,"she began, her admittance pained and strangled."I... I told him the truth. About the night he was conceived, about staying with his father because I thought it was the right thing to do. I told him that it... It was my fault..."Agatha's voice hooked and trembled over her words but the tears had stopped and she looked absolutely hell bent on not letting them start again. Her throat bobbed as she shoved down the nerves enough to make an attempt at continuing.

"It was my fault that Colton treated him the way he did for so much of his life. And... I told him about keeping the coma from him. I... I tried to explain the best I could but... But he was just..."Agatha's lips turned down sharply at the corners and her throat shook again with the sheer force she was using to choke down the emotion that wanted to sink her.

"He was feeling a lot of different things at once,"Rio attempted, though it was weak with her lack of understanding.

"He... He's so upset, and I knew he would be... But he'ssoupset that he... He didn't even lash out. He didn't yell, he didn't throw anything. He didn't even call me insane or selfish or a bitch. He just... said he needed time. And then he left..."

In spite of the fact that she was clearly upset and unsettled by an atypical reaction from someone she knew so very well, there was an edge of anxiety in Agatha's voice that Rio wanted to quell immediately.

Rio leaned in, offering the softest kiss of reassurance before she provided an answer. "He's with Estee in her room. Tay went to the market to get some things." Rio was trying to keep this even, to not let the calm be unseated too badly. This was a painful experience for the both of them and she simply wanted to find them all a way through it. "I thought about having her stop at Del Taco on the way back because it felt like one of those fast-food-bum-around nights, but I don't think anyone's actually going to be hungry this evening."

At this, Agatha managed a half-ass chuckle, more of an acknowledgement that Rio was too smart for her own good than it was anything else.

"So, what is it that you need right now? We can talk about it, we can sit here and drink our coffee, or we can take it inside and go upstairs and turn on the TV while we don't pay any attention to it and just lay in bed. What is best for you right now?" After having been steady for the entire time since Agatha had looked her in the eyes, Rio finally lifted her hand to instead drag her fingers through Agatha's hair, earnest emerald gaze probing for an answer.

The look in Agatha's eyes was contemplative, but Rio could see the depth there, the absolute uncertainty of not knowing how to navigate her own emotions. No matter how he came to be, Nicky was Agatha's everything and being at such an impasse was clearly impacting her in ways not a one of them ever could have anticipated.

"Can we just go lay down?"Agatha's soft question came, wracked with every nerve she was feeling right then.

"Of course, my love."Rio leaned forward and pressed her lips to Agatha's warm forehead, leaving them there for a few extra seconds before she pulled away and stood, holding her right hand out for Agatha to take.

That blue gaze dropped to Rio's hand and glassed over almost instantly at what she saw there, what she would always see there every time she looked at that outstretched hand.

What a soft place to land.

She had been the one to pen it, but she had never known at the time just how true it would come to be and how true it would remain forever. Right then, Rio's only intention was to nurse her wounds in whatever way she possibly could. It didn't matter that it wasn't going to be easy, or that she was bound to incur a few bruises here and there at seeing two of the people she loved most in the world crumbling to pieces. None of that matteredbecauseRio loved them and would do whatever she could to find a way to fix this.

Both of them were entitled to their feelings, and they were feeling very different things for very different reasons. What Rio could do in those moments was tend to her wife in the very same way that her daughter had taken on the task of tending to her brother.

Despite the sheen over her gaze, no more tears spilled down Agatha's cheek and she firmly took hold of Rio's hand, getting to her feet so that they could head inside. The two cups of still-hot coffee sat abandoned on the table in their exit, no longer necessary.

Coffee didn't matter when Agatha was in pain.

Rio had stopped only to swipe a couple of bottles of water from the refrigerator before she caught up with Agatha on the stairs and the continued to tuck themselves into the confines of their bedroom. In a move that was usually only typical of after-hours debauchery, Rio braved to shut the door. It was a way to give Agatha her privacy, to let her know that she could fall apart and have some time to compose herself if a knock happened to come.

The way that Agatha departed from Rio to travel to her side of the bed left Rio watching and aching. Even though Rio knew a softer side of Agatha, this broken one was not something she knew how to navigate, but she was trying. All she knew how to do was be present, to be available, and to be ready to do whatever it was that her wife needed in the moment.

As Agatha dumped herself into bed, it was clear that she just needed to be held and to let her feelings settle. It was likely she was already jumping to the worst conclusions, but if those thoughts started to become too much, Rio knew Agatha would find it in herself to voice them. She knew she had already and she would always have that safety to keep doing so.

Rio knew -- she was convinced -- all there was to know now, and she still would have gone to the ends of the earth to see to it that Agatha recovered from the blow this had all dealt her.

Some would have said Agatha had brought all of it on herself, but Rio knew that would have been insanely reductive. Agatha had led a complex life that had been informed by the way she had been raised and the people that had been around her. She'd done the wrong things at the wrong times and it had built a rickety foundation for her to try to construct a life atop. Clearly, it had failed miserably and she'd needed to start over, which left them in that moment with Agatha curling into Rio's side the very instant her back met the mattress.

Rio's arm wrapped snugly around her, holding her close enough that she could kiss the top of her head, breathing her sentiment against it.

"I love you more than anything, Agatha, and it's going to be okay."

Agatha's reply was barely more than a squeak.

"I know."

She said she knew, but that little sound was not as convincing. Still, she didn't need to be convinced of what Rio was telling her for it to still be true.

Rio had, as she said she would, turned on something completely random and lowered the volume on the television enough that it was a soft hum to fill some of the silence. She often stared at it while Agatha laid on her chest, but she wasn't actually watching whatever was on the screen. Instead, she was thinking about a way forward, a path that they might be able to travel that would wind up at unity once more.

Right then, it seemed a ways off.

For at least an hour, the two of them laid entwined in the center of the bed, Rio hold onto Agatha like she were precious gold, tender and careful with every movement, every stroke through hair or up and down Agatha's spine. There was little Rio was capable of truly doing to aid in repairing such a rift, but one thing she couldalwaysdo was support her wife.

She was still entirely awake and alert when she heard a soft tap on their bedroom door.

"Yeah?" she called loud enough to be heard and encourage entry.

When Nicky was the one to open the door, Agatha was upright in the blink of an eye, but he did not look at her. Instead, his green eyes dropped to Rio and he offered an unsure curve of his lips.

"Hey mama," he greeted, the uncertainty so loud over his quiet words. "Do you... I'm going to go out back and look at the stars... Do you wanna come with me?"

Agatha deflated next to her the very second she realized that he was not ready to speak with her yet, though she had divulged at one point in the hour they'd been laying there that he said he had needed a few days. Still, to feel that hope drain out of her was hard for Rio ina way she knew she did not have an appropriate name for.

Rio realized that he was not actually asking her to look at the stars with him, much in the same way Agatha did. What he needed was to talk, to have someone listen who could offer a unique perspective that he would never be able to obtain otherwise. As much as it pained her to leave Agatha in that bedroom alone, she knew that she had made a vow to love and support them both and such a time had come, it was just a little more of a struggle to make the choice than she had ever surmised it might.

"Of course," she answered, sitting up enough so that she could place a gentle kiss to a discouraged Agatha's cheek, whispering softly against it."I'll be back as soon as I can."

By the time Rio had climbed out of bed, Nicky had already disappeared from the doorway. As she emerged into the hallway, he was heading down the steps and Rio could feel every single spot in every single cavern and crevice of her heart that ached to see her wife and their son both in so much pain. Even worse was knowing that it was necessary, that it had to be felt for them to be able to move forward with a clean slate, everything laid bare.

When she stepped onto the back patio and pulled the door shut behind her, she was surprised to see that he had opted for the bench swing instead of the chairs. Despite that, she still paced over and placed herself next to him, leaving only a couple of inches of space between them.

The crickets chirped and sang in the night and for several minutes, it was the only sound that permeated their space. Rio let it linger a little while longer before her soft tones broke through, a gentle prodding but also an allowance for further introspection.

"Take your time. I'm right here as long as you need me to be," Rio assured him, though she did not turn her head to take him in. If anything, the last thing he was needing was to be scrutinized, or even feel like he was being perceived. Rio held no bias here and was simply at a point where she wanted to heal the people she loved from wounds that were bound to come to light.

Nicky drew in a long, measured breath and exhaled it slowly, pressing his lips together as he tried to find the will within himself to speak. At last, his voice sounded.

"I... I could say I'm not angry, but that's... Not entirely true. The only thing I'm actually angry about is that I don't knowhowto feel," he attempted, though his voice was weak and void of his usually Nicky confidence. "I'm pissed that she waited so long... But then I understand why. I'm hurt that she didn't feel like she could be honest with me once I was an adult, even if I'm not sure it would have made any difference to have this conversation four years ago as opposed to now."

Nicky was a good kid and while he could act arrogant and cocky, Rio had learned pretty quickly that he had a good heart, he was just so fiercely protective of it. This Nicky was the one who had let his guard down only to be hurt by the woman who had given him life.

"I don't actually care about her not telling me he was in a coma. If she would have, even before you came into the picture, I'm not sure I would have wanted to be sucked back into his bullshit again. What I care about... And what hurts the most right now..." The words began to tremble and slide toward one another as he fought to keep going despite the emotion welling inside of him. "What hurts is that I can't help but feel like I wasn't worth the truth."

Rio let this settle, but once it had she was quick to form her response.

"It's not that you weren't worth the truth, Nicky, it was just that she didn't knowhowto tell you. She loves you and... Especially lately, things have been healing and repairing in a way she never thought she would have." Rio paused, this time actually braving a glance at him, her eyes soft as they surveyed him in the dim porch light. "It's always been about trying to protect you, she just... Didn't go about it the right way. And I think... I think we both know that it's deserving of forgiveness more than condemnation."

Nicky actually looked at her that time, not only hearing how much she meant it, but seeing it too. He pressed his lips together and nodded once, turning his gaze out toward the pool as the silence fell over them once again.

A couple minutes passed and Rio had considered asking him what else was on his mind but he answered such an inquiry before she voiced it.

"When you got pregnant with Estee... How... How did you handle it?" He hesitated but still kept his eyes fixed ahead of him. "I just... I know it's different, but... You weren't ready either... And... And when did you tell her?"

Those questions felt like javelins, one after another, throttled directly into Rio's chest, piercing straight through her. She understood his motives and could see what it was he was trying to learn, but Rio knew that it was an outlook that was solely seeking to compare too vaguely similar situations in a big way and Rio simply could not afford to perpetuate that.

"Nicholas," she murmured, turning in her place on the swing to face him fully. "I understandwhyyou're asking that question, but any answer I might provide would not be a fair comparison of the situations. I don't even know that right now, I can provide you a response as to why that is as delicately as you might need. But... I think you already know why."

His lips tucked at the corners and his eyes were shimmering with the threat of tears, but he nodded his understanding anyway, a sign that he knew Rio was right. What followed was another shot to the chest, something that nearly shattered Rio the very moment it touched her ears.

"I thought it was my fault that she didn't love me when I was a kid."

Immediately, Rio made a grab for Nicky's hand, pulling it into both of her own to hold onto it as tightly as she could manage, imbuing every bit of grip strength she had into the exchange. "Hey, hey, no. That's not fair either," she informed him in a gentle murmur, tilting her head at him as she debated how to proceed.

"I... I know that might be how youfeltat the time, but I promise you, Nicholas, thetruthis that your mother hasalwaysloved you. She just... hasn't always known the right way to show it. Back then... She thought that she was leaving you with someone whocouldshow it. She did not know what was going on until you were the one to tell her."

Nicky's lips twisted as he tried to plug that information into the correct inputs, trying to understand it for the truth it was, but Rio could see that he was struggling.

"I..."he attempted, but he seemed to choke on the words that he wanted to use. Rio knew what was coming on the other side of what he had to say even before it happened, like a train wreck, in front of her."I know it isn't true but... I can't help but feel like she never really wanted me."

In confirmation of Rio's suspicion, Nicky's face crumbled and the tears leapt over his lids to roll with rapid succession down his cheeks. Without a moment's hesitation, Rio was closing the space between them and shifting to a position that allowed her to pull her son into her arms, holding him tightly to her chest the way she had done with his mother not more than an hour ago.

An automatic hand raised and smoothed over his short and soft hair, shushing him softly the harder he cried.

In that second, Rio had no clue how she was doing it. She had absolutely no idea how she was able to keep soldiering on through seeing both Agatha and Nicky in such wrecked states. And then, it struck her.

She loved them.

That was how she was doing it.

Rio tipped her head forward and pressed her lips to the crown of Nicky's head, letting them rest there briefly before she found her ability to speak, channeling her thoughts into his hair in the softest whispers.

"Your mother loves you and I love you. Your sisters love you. And even if he hasn't said it directly yet,Hmi loves you too. You are a very important and impossibly valued member of this family. Each and every one of us love everything you are, even the you that is hurt and upset right now."Rio's hand dropped from Nicky's head and landed instead on his shoulder, palm cupping so smooth over it."You are an amazing young man, Nicholas, and not a day goes by that she is not both thankful and proud that you are her son. Of anything in the world to know, Ineedyou to know that."

Rio had not expected an answer. What she had expected was for the weight of that to hit him with a bit of force, force that might cause him to cry harder. She had been correct. All she could do in response was hold him tighter, cling to him a little more to show that she was there with him, that she was thereforhim.

She was patient, letting him work through it and get it out of his system. He did not move from her hold by the time he finally relocated his ability to speak.

"I think I need to go to Auckland... To be with Hmi for afew days. Just... To process."

While Rio knew that such a decision would surely bring more pain for Agatha, it was a reasonable response to the whirlwind of what he was experiencing.

"Book yourself a flight,"Rio encouraged."Pack a bag and I'll have the girls take you to LAX."

This seemed to have caught him off guard, judging by the way he lifted his head and looked over at her, brow knit in confusion.

"Really?"he asked, raising a hand to wipe at his puffy and red eyes.

"Yes, really. You don't have to tell her, I will. But... Can you promise me that you'll come back?"The question was gentle, tender in that she wanted to know for certain that this situation had not reached the point of no return.

"I'll come back when I'm ready, I promise,"he told her, his beautiful green eyes so honest in the light from the porch and the moon combined.

"Then get your things ready. I'll let Estee and Tay know when I go back upstairs."

The expression that filled his face was somehow a perfect blend of relief and gratitude, as if he had ever considered the idea that Rio might try to fight him on what he thought the best course of action for himself was. She leaned forward and pressed her lips to his forehead briefly before she pulled back and got to her feet.

"Mama?"came his voice, small and quiet behind her.

She turned so that she could meet his gaze from where he sat, but he quickly pushed himself up and surged forward, wrapping Rio in a tight hug, clinging to her for the better part of a minute. He did not say anything throughout the duration of the embrace and even as he let her go, it still took him a few moments to find his voice.

"I love you. Thank you."

She raised a hand, the backs of her knuckles brushing gingerly over his cheek in a show of every ounce of affection she felt for him.

"I love you, too, Nicky. Have a safe flight but please let one of us know when you get there and get toHmi's, okay?"Rio figured it was an easy enough bargain he could uphold.

Without another word, he hugged her again, though this one did not last quite as long. His hold loosened, but his hands slid to her shoulders before he finally let go.

"Will you..."he started but bit his bottom lip as if to stop himself. When he tried to continue, Rio realized it was because he had been trying to stave off his emotions at what he was trying to say."Will you tell her that I love her? And I'll be back? Just... Just tell her that, okay?"

Rio gave him a nod that carried with it as much sincerity as she could possibly manage.

"I will, just as she would want me to tell you that she loves you, and we will be here when you return."

Nicky's face contorted in a pained smile, his eyes glassing over again. His Adam's apple quivered slightly and he seemed to have one last thing to say.

"We are so fucking lucky to have you mama... I really hope you know that." With that known, he leaned forward and gave her a soft peck on the cheek and turned to disappear inside the pool house to pack his things.

Planted, Rio simply stared at the closed door, the shadows whipping around inside as Nicky moved about his task. She knew her sentiment would never reach him through the wood and drywall, but it still left her lips in the softest of whispers anyway.

"Not nearly as lucky as I am to have you both."

Chapter End Notes

i'm sorry don't be too mad at me okay???

Dance In Your Color

Reflecting in your light
 You're my horizon
 You'll always paint my sky
 *****

Even before Rio made it back up to the bedroom, she knew that she was in for a night of little sleep.

She had been right.

Agatha hadn't cried, but the emotion in the room had been unbearably heavy. It wasn't a comforting weight, wasn't one that subdued any wild emotions. Instead, it was something that teetered on the edge of becoming smothering.

Rio had been rather brief when she had loosely outlined her conversation with Nicky, and while she was fully aware that Agatha understood why, Rio could also tell that she was hating every minute of the censorship. It was required but still detested.

Rio did not like not being completely up front with Agatha, but with how delicate the entire situation was, it called for careful hands and a measured release of information. She had told Agatha that he was leaving, that the girls would see him off andHmi would be there to pick him up when he landed. She had told Agatha what he had entrusted Rio to relay in that he did love her, he just needed some time. She had told Agatha, with the most sincerity she felt capable of managing, that it was all going to be okay, they just had to give it time.

While disliking the circumstances, Agatha seemed to accept such an answer.

Or, she tried, at least.

Never once did she try to provide any vocal reason why she had to jump into action to fix the problem, but as she tried to rest, she proved just howrestlessshe was actually feeling.

It had started with her head on Rio's chest, curled into her side. Then, she had rolled to her back and Rio had mimicked Agatha's previous position, fastening against her side. A short while later, Agatha rolled with her back to Rio and with no hesitation, Rio was on the move, wrapping her body around Agatha's from behind. Wherever Agatha tried to go within the confines of that bed, Rio was right there, stuck to her like glue.

Agatha was hurting.

Rio knew that she couldn't mend it, couldn't wave her hands and make it all better, but she could support her wife in a time when her heart was aching in ways neither of them understood. The capabilities she possessed to show Agatha support and love and care when she could not find those things within herself were endless for Rio.
